poems.title: On the Doorstep of your Studio, while you Sleep Within
poems.author: Yusuf Misdaq
poems.content:
"Wa laylee itha sajaa" *

I sit between a long-legged
Thin spider that rests in the corner of a
Midnight plant.
And to my right, a small slug.
I am snug in between them both
The night is theirs
I am the visitor.

I have come on Earth to taste sweetness
To watch spiders
See fences errected
Closed flowers under the black mixture of
Moon and fog.

Faraway light that leaves
And the distant sound, also faraway
Of neighbourhood sirens and conflict
Small and dry sound
Like the spider
It is never far
Our father of death.

For these years of life
The truthful clouds
Pluming and roseing
Blooming and passing
Have watched me as I watched them
They have seen how
poems.note: * Quran 93:2

poems.title: Echoing of Chasmic Vervours
poems.author: Yusuf Misdaq
poems.content:
Firey hands touch the material and
Everything burns up to
Immediate flame 

The game is gone and
The hand is played

When the point of breathing at nothing comes 
Your chasmic vervour 
Shimmers as a black patch upon a 
Lava crawl 

Everything will melt unto 
Pure nothing 

The body a sumptuously devoured flake bidden bye

A mind that made a million molehills is now one with the mountain

A fountain of Divine lava 
The final sentence of Gods love in this life
The crumbling meandering overwashing that must happen
To all forms
Before gas and spirit 
begin to form
Anew 

The Godliness of us 
Marks us

We can’t go quietly 
We are so Divine we 
Will never shut down

Like some silly line 
A child drew 
We keep on flowing 
From river to sea 
     and
From sea we 
Are siphoned off into 
Eternity

poems.title: az gul amadee
poems.author: Yusuf Misdaq
poems.content:
Prime coming. 
A sure force
Aligning such that
Two rhythms and
     Timelines begin merging.

~

Channels untucked.
   Rapidly dissipating residuals
  That which remains of the statue 
  Is what love refused to
        Cast away.   

~

Sixteen places out
Uncategorized peripheries

In dreams we met there
And in life we are
   Trying to square the clouds
   Into something
   The sun can shine on.

poems.title: Plane to Medina
poems.author: Yusuf Misdaq
poems.content:
Bigger than generational wealth 

A calling into the future
Down the everlong tunnel of my descendants
Here we were, I’ll say
On each others shoulders
Gifting you the latest transmissions 

We heard and obeyed
Passed on what we could
May He have mercy on us
What limitations we were bound by!
Love and loneliness and living in a time of 
Dis ease and desperation

Aside from our darling period, before we came of age, 
It has all been a storm. 
We’ve weathered it as best we could 
For your sake

For your sake, o our children!

Calling you from where you listen 
In heavenly oceans 
Awaiting birth awaiting love
Awaiting your come up

You don’t know how much we
Long for you
To be among us
Back where you belong

Oh my child!
Precious child!
Stay forever while you leave
Stay by my side forever 
My beauty…

I will watch you grow
Out of what I was
And into yourself

And only then will I know
My time has come
To let go.

My perfume purpose 
Having filled this earth 
My scent stamped and 
My descendants ready, 

Able 
to 
Run.
poems.note: February 2022. Plane.

poems.title: Remembering Carmel
poems.author: Yusuf Misdaq
poems.content:
Can glass be blown backwards 
      Can solid go back to liquid?

We keep fantasizing about it
In films and in
Showers as we close our eyes
And in sexuality as we liquify

We walk timidly towards the ocean 
.It’s cold, and that scares us.
But we still go there
And we still want to be in it

The liquid crystal embalming us
The water now warm 
A rhythm emerging in our minds 
We swaying and our arms waving 
Dizzying off as some
Lovely slimey thing
Tickles our ankles and small toes

Where have we gone?
What is this familiar place?
Where is my mother if 
This is origin?

Or does this go back further?
It might because 
I can see stars up in this pale blue sky.

And I see globes that were planets
And beyond them 
Beyond all
Known science
A slanted door
To another realm 

The door is the size of all the universes I just saw 
And the realm behind it is so limitless that 
Concepts like size are gone

I open my eyes 
waist deep in this 
clear blue
angelness

As I re-emerge onto the beach 
The people look at me strangely 
Even though I walk one pace at a time
With my limbs I have.

The beach people have tinny instruments that emit sound waves
Poor quality transmissions on limited frequencies of 
Sound with no width in 
Any sense.

Crimes against humanity look like this
A sleepy forgetfulness

And as I notice the curve of her summer dress
I smile remembering 
I am rejoining this 
Beautiful mess.

poems.title: Untitled
poems.author: Yusuf Misdaq
poems.content:
Linear Marouf 
Merciful lines scar the sky 
Say a sangeen fare thee well 
Holding out one hand that waves
Emotion unspoken and if it be received
As a hard token, so be it. 
Everything in its time falls
Passions rise and inevitable
Loves eyes and its back of minds 
Where the boys go running
And the girls hiding
A dark void to be 
Alone 
and feel.

poems.title: Goodbye
poems.author: Yusuf Misdaq
poems.content:
Goodbye my heart

Radiant beauty is yours
I’ve seen it and touched it 
I’ve been inside you
You wept and couldn’t speak

But you gush open and your
Body 
Waters your heart. 

Every secret in you and
Every formulation within the grasp of your fine mind

But 
         the dancing and the 
                                                 stillness: 
   Less trodden
   Less traversed 
   Less tickled.

poems.title: Desires
poems.author: Yusuf Misdaq
poems.content:
Parody becomes reality  
The absurd blends imperceptibly into our daily dose  
Before we know it we are nodding in agreement  
Buying everything, seriously 
Like a German listening intently to a sarcastic joke they don’t get.    

We are capable of sinking like a stone to the bottom of a filthy pond  
So much can be added to our weight
So quickly, new desires can become ours  
And we long for it, and it acts us out 

We move in ways we never would  
Miming out the persona of someone we don’t recognize  
Praying for something we never thought we wanted 

Strangers to ourselves  
No hearts within us  
But awash with these new desires 
All that remains are the desires in us  

Clicking us into movement as our limbs 
Jerk into action and sprawl us across the cities.

poems.title: A Poem for Electronica Musicians
poems.author: Yusuf Misdaq
poems.content:
Sometimes I wonder if 
I sold my soul to the arpeggiator   

Sometimes I wonder if  
I let the wrong one in  

Sometimes I wonder if  
I've been surfing a wave that isn't my own  

Sometimes I wonder if  
I could drop all the coins and start anew  

Firey teardrops velveting down my mountainous robes
Into the black chasm that takes three days to reach 
The earth of earth 
Wherein lies a bubbling spring

poems.title: Untitled
poems.author: Yusuf Misdaq
poems.content:
far reaching star unfolds  
there has been sand that  
feels for me rising  
feels for me  
sun in my hand   

in my mouth  
there is  
crystal spuck  

real fabrication  
spitting out mist  
emitting rarified  
luck

landing upon your  
shoulders ive come  
to hold you from  
behind and place 
hands upon your 
lower back that  
energize and ironize  
glueing you 
contagious   

i hold your breath 
in my palms i will  
heal you               
               r skin  
through skin  
i encounter 
essence  

your ink 
before it made words 

your dark ink  
that i saw and know 
before it filled your  
receptacle and  
made float 

your vessels 
i knew your  
inky origins  

and everything that you do  
would be as natural to me as  
water on my hands and  
interlocking my fingers and 
holding you from behind  
us locked in to one.

poems.title: Prep Coffee
poems.author: Yusuf Misdaq
poems.content:
Chimes echo out of the starlight  
A bird chases a squirrel down a tree 
Happenings in the orbital sky 
Twinkling stars and the look in your eye    

Touch me 
Don’t touch me 
Reach far in  

Love me 
Don’t come, just   
   Stay                     
                   as you are    

A far river 
In the eyes sunken distance 
The green, dreaming hills 
Melting without insistence  

Pie on the wind
Food from a lover prepared
Kindness pellets
Love, touch me by the air.  

*

They turn the volume down self-consciously when Nirvana comes on
They think it’s too rough for this sun
But really
The friction makes the moonlight smoother
poems.note: For Wazo

poems.title: Sleepy Poem
poems.author: Yusuf Misdaq
poems.content:
My temple is certified and affluent 
when denied and dented 

It fills with smoke which also clears, 
and settled suns which also rise. 

My tears are drowning fears which slowly vapour 
clear on up,

Cloud is me and you and all our 
pain that cries to feel relieved, 

Rain on earth is vapour, we are cycles, we are 
circles. 

All the time forgetting, 'til we 
turn and must remember.

poems.title: Twinners
poems.author: Yusuf Misdaq
poems.content:
Adjoining rooms
   You visit me when mine is flooded
      richly with sun
   I’ll come to yours, too, 
      At the mirrored moment of our day
Correspondingly 
   We’ll talk water particles 
      into the sand particles 
         and our desert will 
           balance and lose
              its sting

poems.title: Untitled
poems.author: Yusuf Misdaq
poems.content:
Chiming is everything 

That’s the motto I live by 

I sit in a resonant room 
 of hammered metal pans
  gongs and tuning forks 
   but I make no move
     and in silence
      await you in 
       anticipation of 
        the noise you will 
         come with and 
          how each chime
           will dictate the 
            next moment

poems.title: Airways
poems.author: Yusuf Misdaq
poems.content:
A trigonal
                 muck 
For six paces
       Keep your nose out of 
           my airspaces
                  
My airways aren’t yet clear
   It’s obvious and apparent 
    as blockages always are

The state of the world (burning)
    ironically requires long 
         cooling breaths 
           which in 
              turn
        necessitate 
       clear airways                     

Having experienced the serenity of regular meditation, 
I have become one of those lucky people who can say things like 
‘if only everyone (or enough people) could blow 
cool calming air onto the world 
things would change.'

poems.title: Untitled
poems.author: Yusuf Misdaq
poems.content:
Salient touching stones
   mark up with clinks 
the noise re-arrangements 
and uncommon 
demanifestings 
all signed off 
unicorn signatures
avid signatories 
fiery tributaries
modern ritual flushers

poems.title: No Title
poems.author: Yusuf Misdaq
poems.content:
No one asked and 
   therefore never knew 
     of the goldfish that 
        swim inside me
      they tickle 
        and keep my torso 
          on its toes 

The manifesting gatherer 
  that lives in the center 
   of the berry forest
  wages all their fortunes 
   on the snow coming 
     out gold this   
      spring season 
         but the ax 
  wielding barbarian 
scientists have already 
set in motion the 
burning/harvesting schedule 
for the next 71 years
which is when they calculate
that all of the resources will 
finally be excavated and evaporated 
“then, and only then,” said Chuck
“Will we exit with dignity.”

poems.title: Untitled
poems.author: Yusuf Misdaq
poems.content:
Mansion
               sell my home

I want to live with you
 my zip code will change to you
  and six of my seven names
   will become your names

     the straightest legendary lovers
      must become women
       it has to happen.

poems.title: In Every Injury
poems.author: Yusuf Misdaq
poems.content:
I keep falling and in 
   every red graze 
                            on my knee
                      I see your
                    loving (of) me.

poems.title: Days
poems.author: Yusuf Misdaq
poems.content:
I have to walk out to the gallows 
Each time I leave my home

  that’s what life begins to feel like

But I’m walking with freed will 
Knowing the torture is really 
  nurture.

poems.title: The Mountaineer — D E F R O C K E D
poems.author: Yusuf Misdaq
poems.content:
I climb to the top of the ladder
 muezzin move
all to declare to the world
 that I’m a man 
   that, I promise, I’m a man. 

I can strike !
 make fire !
pound the mountain and 
stand on top. 

I can’t fly 
My thuddy vesture keeps 
heavy clods entrenched 
                                      in 
    soil and sod. 

I’m sad and small 
  Behind a nightingales call
My all, summarized
  and standing tall is
  aught but a speck
  of filigree dust

Must my shadow and 
    Ancestus reduce me 
      punishingly down
   to the lower-ranked
      classes?

If I don’t listen and
  take heed I surely 
    will achieve magnificence
      but only in the manner
        of my comeuppance 
    wherein a great white 
        thunder strike shall 
          seek my skull end 
                             and 
        fling me off
this goliath mound. 

Or, if the wise back-tredder
   is found within my 
      puffed-up foolery 
   and I tender my self 
     and step down 
     returning to my 
    simple village of chums
     where I was only 
            (but always) me… 



A carrot in the tree
 some later month or three
    just me alone 
 knees up by my ears
like I was twenty (and
   not forty) three
munching contentedly 
   as the orange sun 
     breaks free. 

“My family, I have
   they know me!”  
A satisfying, brave 
    crunch of nothing 
 to accompany my 
great economy epiphany

poems.title: "Shukran"
poems.author: Yusuf Misdaq
poems.content:
"Shukran,"
spoken softly 

the warm chain 
that binds action
to ethic

poems.title: My Invisible Career circa. 2024
poems.author: Yusuf Misdaq
poems.content:
An infinite mind 
that keeps on 
creating new vistas 
and variations 

they never knew me 
and now they call it "A.I."

I laugh, because
nothing insults me

poems.title: The Future
poems.author: Yusuf Misdaq
poems.content:
wherever I have left 
to go 
awaits 
           me
    excitedly

poems.title: Fasting amongst average Muslims
poems.author: Yusuf Misdaq
poems.content:
'Don't use your mind,'
I want to tell the boy who is unaware
He is silhouetted by a sun 
in the window behind him
As he tells me energetically that 
it's too late for me to eat the food
that I've just been given. 
'Use your eyes!'

These salafis are taking
the most beautiful aspect of Islam
 - its nearness to nature - 
and are actively anesthetizing it
until eventually 
all that's left will be 
lux scents
marble floors and 
a golden statue 
of Cristiano Ronaldo.

poems.title: Untitled
poems.author: Yusuf Misdaq
poems.content:
It's always night in space
Steps in floating zero 
Your astro hands up like
a mime or a helpless blind 
person 

Your eyes may as well be closed
Your lips smacking together feebly 
You are a dot 
                          passing through the great
Infinite.

poems.title: Lillianne aka Lily
poems.author: Yusuf Misdaq
poems.content:
Lillanne Pharaohdust
 Lillyanne Thomlinson 
  Lillyanne of the pond and lake
    Lillyanne of the boudoir 
      (before it's too late)
    She applies blusher to her cheeks
       and stick to her cake hole
    She's been on fire since the day she was born
       Lillyanne desert 
          Lillyanne valley 
              Lilzy jokes by the poolside
                 Playing cards with the cool guys
                    Flowin jus like a moon tide
                      Glowin just like a moon rise 

              Cool Lily 
                                   Water Lily 
                  Moistily

poems.title: Pre Nuptual Eulogy
poems.author: Yusuf Misdaq
poems.content:
1
Oh God
Crack open the dark 
Prism in the
 dark chasm in
  the silent hole
    in me. 

If You scan Your ray 
    of light on 
  that hidden 
    shadow jewel 
  You will show me
    and the world
  what it means
     'being alive.'

I have never ever prayed 
   for electrocution 
   or destruction in my life. 

But if it be at Your loving hands, 
   "take me!" 

I give unto 
   I leave me
       to You. 

Flame away me
   My hands raised
      Like a flag up 
         in flames. 

I wave goodbye
  Left to right
     sway away 
        into the light. 

2
Maybe other things 
 will remain out
        lasting me
     I will accept 
      coming out early 

Ash. Toblerone. Booze. 
      I never felt right
      sharing the stage
    with so many games. 

When I was young I wanted 
   to cover everything 
      in flames. 

Now that I'm serious
  I ask only You God
    To flood my bloody 
        body with Your
        magic electrons
            and let me 
         join the ranks
         of the natural
                ones.

poems.title: A Feeling, the weight of a Butterfly
poems.author: Yusuf Misdaq
poems.content:
Perceval. Palleme. Proser. 
Point-in-fact.  .Past.Time.

Where does it go?

If I wear a mink coat or a suit.
If I shave my head or let it go Lennon. 
If I love and be loved or
                                             Leave everyone 
Laid out where they stand

What does it change?

Only your heart is sacred to me, my dearest 
And no longer to rush you, wish I
No longer to encase and embrace you
Just to stand opposite where we behold each other;
 Feel each others
Trembling presence

Continuing into one another

With no worldly wheeling 
With no watchfulness
No wattage nor
Wasting of time, which is 
Without time, in this, our 
Wantless wish

poems.title: Untitled
poems.author: Yusuf Misdaq
poems.content:
We don’t look upon this Sea as gateway to dream 
It’s only location, 
and wet, 
and grey-brown colour.
Brighton or Hove.

But when it pulls its top up
And shows its flat stomach, dotted with illumined pebbles 
And chilled gulls
And when we walk into it (when it invites us in)
And we stand on sand
And feel secure (sinking-dissolving)
And become part of the waves, a sibling to them
And leave our world
And feel special.
Chosen.

Then is when your eyelashes may flutter inexplicably 
And sharp, fresh thoughts may slice in for you

Then is when your Tiger-Heart is polished
And framed centrally within a Slow Golden 
Unfolding case with
Refined, fruit-size jewels embedded all around it 
Glinting in ridiculous colour

Then is when the silent power inside you crows 
Echoes and tides out across this flat Sun-Forest 
This land of Rolling Arrivals
This Rounded Green Mover
This
         Coming
                          .Sea.

poems.title: Sunset Seagull at Sea
poems.author: Yusuf Misdaq
poems.content:
.Sunset-Seagull at Sea. 
.Distant . Delivered.
.Does not die . Is kept alive. 
.Amidst the purple
                                Re-enchanter.


.Sunset-Seagull at Sea.
.Curl a new way, un-calibrated. 
.Will not die, with Sky
                                      has mated. 
.Spawning friends that fly unfurling.


.Sunset-Seagull at Sea.
.First to know, from your final-distance. 
.Thrusting forwards, blazing deeper. 
.You are the witness of the Final Weeper.

poems.title: Dark Sea After Sunset
poems.author: Yusuf Misdaq
poems.content:
When the crashing sea has smashed my sadness to spittle, I turn around and climb the steep hill of pebbles to return home.

My feet sink as I climb
Just as they did when I had child-feet. 
Now they sink down heavier
But I am a stronger climber.

And when I reach the top, I look broadly into a distance, and the wind surfs through my hair, and I feel like a handsome champion of bravery, possessor of courage; renewed and ready to fly forwards into future furlongs

poems.title: The West Pier (Realised)
poems.author: Yusuf Misdaq
poems.content:
.Complex ghost. 
.Future foresight irony. 
.Embedded sea-stud.

Thud of matter 
Presence important

The last living thing in this slipping city

S’not pretty
S’staring at nobody
Lets itself mean a lot to me

S’not clogged up by hearts & guts
S’not so bitter ’bout the parts and cuts 
Leaves behind all its betrayed trust 
Living all alone in the fabric sea:
(a spread-out bed-sheet, blown with air)

I will not be surprised
If finally one day
They scrape the money together
And you are scrapped
And turned into a luxury hotel on the water
Or something else which further alienates the normal people 
Pandering to the rich

N’I won’t mourn neither 
Won’t moan again
Or compose a sad song 
When they remodel you Into some aberration

(Because) I was here to witness
The best years of your Burning death

I extracted every Ounce of Glory you Gave away
As you sunk and degraded

You do not grieve
For that which you did not take for granted.

poems.title: The West Pier (Imagined)
poems.author: Yusuf Misdaq
poems.content:
Let go of all the pie and fluff,
Admit that this frame is all that’s beneath us.
All of us must trust in the blackness of each other’s bones 
As much as we must trust in the gaps
                                                               which give birth to thrones 
                                     which allow for the blue-God-sky-tones    
                                             and fluid homes

For a man to trust in transience and telepathy is rare 

But we must.

For a man to sit in a green space like Brunswick Square 
Thinking with total sinceriousness about the old West Pier is rare too.

But I do.

poems.title: Untitled
poems.author: Yusuf Misdaq
poems.content:
A coronary artery 
The milling of time
I've turned into so many people
The lines tangled.

poems.title: Father, upon a cliff (one week after Big Sur)
poems.author: Yusuf Misdaq
poems.content:
A side uncovered
A child untold
A sparkling ember
A million memory

A glittering century
Resplendent finery 
Lost in dreams
Rupturing seams
of Time, the past, 
Not what is seems. 
I was a boy
Am not yet old
Stand upon the edge
Of the cliff unsold. 
Still like the mist
Free with the rift
From the moat I float
Waves lift and kiss
"Take me within"
As away I drift
Approaching the merge
of karma & kin
My brother within
My mother, my me
My father, the wind
Blowing cooly in rhythms
Alternate rhythms
Strange studded stars
In different time
For his spirit is far

A side recovered 
A child informed
A sparkling whisper
From there to ear.

poems.title: Epistle to Mine Own Self (Prelude to Vanlife)
poems.author: Yusuf Misdaq
poems.content: Unfinished symphony comes after the crumbs. I've always lived in slums, it's time to exit my ghetto and create a palace. So many have tried to pin me down. They used to call it a crucifixion. But I'm small in their eyes, and that word is large to them. They content themselves to throw little traps and pits before me. But for the mercy and unflinching love of my Creator, I would have fallen into all of them. My shoulder and back has been made flexible and firm by my oaths of allegiance to the True friends of God. Had it not been decreed that I be counted among their number (and I pray this bond remain evermore) I would have fallen and faded long ago.

poems.title: Oracioneum
poems.author: Yusuf Misdaq
poems.content:
Chime untethered
Pillowy smithereens
I'm jest floating
Fantastic levitation
   Held in a private hall 
Such that I draw no attention 
   And my majesty is but a testament to God
 from God
  Returning as all will 
    to God
and again 
    to God
until all is all 
a billowing circle of light
    of God
    of God
    of the God Almighty 
 Blessed and sanctified be He
    Beyond all description.

poems.title: Call
poems.author: Yusuf Misdaq
poems.content:
Sirens firing into the very lining
Stitching ripping

  In the naked pool I am 
   My truth rippling outward
     Can you recognize the echoes
   And trace their relation to 
       The truth of what I am?

poems.title: Intro/Outro
poems.author: Yusuf Misdaq
poems.content:
Whirley Swirleys
   A definite beginning 
     Singing of singing
     Swimming in pools
   All the tantric rules
  In a still pose held for 
  no seconds in a graceful era
     of abundance. 

My star is a quiet dancer. 
 The mouth is closed and
  Maybe the eyes are too
   And this doesn't stop
    the most persuasive
     sunlight bursting 
      outwards. 

A cruel way to go is crying. 
   It should be laughing. 
If you've done your job right
   You laugh your way 
      out of this life. 

Goodbye, you wave, grinning inwardly
   Your head rocking sloppy
     in the car park you're
       walking out of on 
         foot. 


         warm 
The    gun    sun beckons you.

poems.title: Master of Nothing
poems.author: Yusuf Misdaq
poems.content:
Cartoonishly the life blood flows
Dropping like maggots off an unhygienic countertop
Giving me stereotypical bad days so that my relationship ends and my car has 4 bird shits on it for 4 decades of pissy love fired into the ether, a grand universe of wise men on thrones with perfect stars-in-arms, 
the retrograde diameter of beatific relationship between creature & creator
boulder and crater
yesteryear and later

Whatever passes for fuel around here
Dinosaurs blood or sunflower oil or 
the iridescent 
Sun rays on my 
Closed-eye-face
 an answer to prayer
Fill me up with it!
Great sex or celibacy 
Fasting of feasting 
Loving or being in a very dark place... 

I have known many grades of fuel and I know enough to know I no longer know and am not a master of chess. 

So, like a fool, 
I open myself up like a cracked egg
            or a happy child at rest
             sitting absolutely still 
                  and waiting for 
                    just whatever
                      God wants
                          to give 
                             me.

poems.title: Signals Unbecoming
poems.author: Yusuf Misdaq
poems.content:
Signals unbecoming
Rigid pulses of disguised dogma
Tell us keep on hiding
Old white messengers we're 
Supposed to be inspired by 
A double knife we're holding 
As we decide which side
Won't cut us and 
We haven't realized 
Knives are not mandated.

poems.title: Waking Up
poems.author: Yusuf Misdaq
poems.content:
I had a dream we were dying 
Killing each other  
Feasting on the cartel carousel 

I had a dream we were dying slowly 
While we had cousins in the hot part of the world 
Dying quickly

I had this dream where we were losing 
All hope
Through computer screens

I had a dream where our faith and our 
Precious time 
Was being taken away from us

I had this crazy dream we had all willingly signed up for this 
Nightmare experiment 
Where we became profiles

I had a dream we were files

I had a dream they’d finally figured out how to beam us away
Like in Star Trek 
But it was only because we’d turned into 
Digital dust and signed away 
Our sacred trust.

I had a dream the mountains looked at us
And then said, 
If you don’t want your souls 
Give them to us
We’ll do our best.

I had a dream our hands were lost
I had a dream our hands had turned into individual functions
And each person only got one
So that a scissor man could only cut 
And never paint
And a paintbrush man could never kiss 
And that the singer could only be poor and beg
And the machine gun men tried to touch statues and 
Feel their texture but they ended up 
Destroying everything 
And shooting the beautiful ones

I had a dream the machine gun men
Drowned other men alive
And burned their skin off 
And laughed at the suffering they caused. 
I had a dream that after all that they turned around and said to me, 
We're your brothers.

I had a dream we were all talking in a big loud cacophony
And everyone only cared about what they were saying
And in the dream, I looked in a mirror and saw myself 
Rotten and disgusted and disintegrated.

I had a dream that nobody cared anymore 
And that even the ones who cared were cheapened and isolated 
By being praised, pumped and hyped like pleasing  
Freaks in a clown show that was just about to end.

I had a dream we lived in a small cave and had only a few channels.
I had a dream everyone had their own hero and said
To hell with your hero. My hero is the real hero.

I had a dream you never really loved me
You just wanted a higher platform for your self to 
Love yourself.

I had a dream I never really loved you I was just 
Sharpening my sword upon you.

*

I had this dream and I woke up 
And I looked in the mirror

And I saw myself
Still alive.

I saw that there was still something there 
A small, fading light 
That the dream did not speak of
Or permit.

A small memory of 
Purity
Residing in the wound of one of my eyes.

If it were made to bloom again
I might see a butterfly and a garden again.

As it is, I have nothing but this faint 
Distant 
Glimmer. So small
It’s barely a feeling
Almost just a theory.



In the dreadful dawn of the world I will sleep in tonight
I must make myself believe 
That this small glimmer
Is worth believing in 
So strongly that I let my life
Lean toward it

As the sun goes down
I must believe in 
What barely seems
Possible.
poems.note: Source: Unoriginal Prayers for Desperate Men (Nefisa UK, 2015). Out of print

poems.title: Parade Perplex
poems.author: Yusuf Misdaq
poems.content:
Parade perplex redown paramount sound 
Marshes of miniature and macroture  
Parsings and delimiters applied
Haphazardly crafting a 
Pattern from 
Random
ness

So Beautiful 
Say the tourists
Another way to say 
'So never seen that before.'
'So anything different I like.'

poems.title: Untitled
poems.author: Yusuf Misdaq
poems.content:
Degrees of control are loosened as 
Annuals are released and  
Doubts about our real size begin.  

Problems necessitate ideals.  
A pre-determined set of expectations 
That should go as planned or desired.  

The grip is loosened and the hands of  
Wiser ones contain less sweat 
Less odor and  
Less slippage

As the annuals and bi annuals  
Rain down and turn brown  

We go green with each passing year 
Allowing belief in God to  
Guide us 
One by one, releasing our insistence on being  
Guides to God’s belief  

We go green  
Believing in the dynamism and unlimited potential  
of the unseen   

There is no dream that cannot be had.

poems.title: Your Royal Pearliness
poems.author: Yusuf Misdaq
poems.content:
Your royal Pearliness  
May I have the honour of your dance? 
May you romance my heart 
Touch it from the outside 
Make motions upon my chest  

A man needs to know he is 
Valued  

And seeing your thin elegant palms 
Making movements upon me 
Gives me power  
Gives me power

Your courageous gorgeousness 
Improves me and 
Moves me.

I’ve given in to you 
I’ll let you leave me
Be my wind 
Blow upon me

Give me everything in this moment 
And we’ll have   
A purple, unfolding infinity 
Hereafter, my love 
Here and thereafter  
For all time and  
As all fire burns 
And oceans turn

I will always love you.

poems.title: Prorogue
poems.author: Yusuf Misdaq
poems.content:
Prorogue parliament  
Furlough the workers  
When the privileged are getting screwed 
In what foul condition must this wall be!

poems.title: Stories (Remembering Libya)
poems.author: Yusuf Misdaq
poems.content:
Sirte destiny  

We went there fluttering   

Our deaths flicking in and out  
Of existence on the long line  
Highway.   

The story I made that day 
My death and its meaning
Somehow didn’t come true

Perhaps my story today
Is fiction, too.

poems.title: Rose Park
poems.author: Yusuf Misdaq
poems.content:
Refried past keeps returning  
New beautiful faces 
Carry the same  
Trays of wisdom.    

Sharp sight  
Burns the eyes  
If you cannot  
Do as you’re shown  

Divorce yourself from  
All expectation   

Let guards down  
Be an open fool  

For all that it’s worth  

(Far more than love)

poems.title: My Soft Song at the Center of Rushing Water
poems.author: Yusuf Misdaq
poems.content:
Chime in anytime, 
I say to You  
Hovering  
Throughout  
My valentinian opening  

I know you’re there  
Slicing the ingredients 
Placing the words in me 
Firing and activating my  
Dust-divine.   

All I do is call  
My inner arms always  
Swinging wide open 
When I’m hunched up 
In these bitchy streets  

I’m basking in constant fame  
Calling Your Name hitherto  
Unseen in the faux-green  
Hills and rapids.     

The water flashes fast  
An ever-ending gush 
Wild delighted droplets 
In a force of rushing thrust  

I am inside the white of the water 
My slow song moves through it  
At the center of its raging performance 

Throughout its fountainous fury 
My steady song, sine waves and 
Sanguine frequencies  

A dharma of calm   
In God’s palm.

poems.title: Untitled
poems.author: Yusuf Misdaq
poems.content:
Moon-motion
Fallid restaries.
Fire in the moments of sanitary coming  

Breaking us open
The cracked iron
Reveals our
Light  

Eyes and  
Everything along the birth canal  
Shooting out light
That attracts like nothing else  

Let us run freely  
In anticipation of
Union.

poems.title: Bad
poems.author: Yusuf Misdaq
poems.content:
Stemming from the bourgeois tunnels
Vividly proud  
Your train delivers mental, rapid junctures  
Ridges across the joints 
All along the gentle hills of my pretty song

I come to you for these interruptions 
Your beckoning shimmering hands  
Call out to me 
A pallid cold sweat  
An unhealthy desperation  
Begging me to come nearer

I know you are a harbinger of disaster 
And I want my simple love song to dip
Into this world of destruction.

poems.title: Irvine
poems.author: Yusuf Misdaq
poems.content:
signs
bird eggs 
she saw when she was over thirty-four 
and babies every day were all she saw

ignore it
embrace the warm and tidy explanations
like npr and science

it’s an easier life when
it can be summed up  

they live contained  
in yoga pants and
manicured beards 
nothing is truly irrational 
and there is no genius or dissent.  

i feel as though i am living
in some modern tidy german city (or Irvine) 
and the demons of normalcy have spiked the water with anaesthetic  

it’s hard to say    
let’s enable mess.

poems.title: Shuntitled (Art Market, Music Business, Poetry Industry)
poems.author: Yusuf Misdaq
poems.content:
contractual subjugation

I’ve filled in a whole fucking form
And you are standing there tapping your feet
Smartly like sonic the hedgehog waiting for my rain 
To fall on you.

I wonder what they think
Do they want a drink of a drink
Or do they want something that
Makes them think of a drink that fits
Neatly into their two by fours?

I wonder do they like sprite or ketchup?
Do they smother themselves in peanut butter?
Do they ever need to de clutter? 
Is my amazing poem an amazing poem?
Or is it something that doesn’t fit and is
Therefore useless.

Of course I know that’s not true
It has its place in the universe says Cindy
and the radiant energy of each of us
Manifest as pure light she says the words
Bumbling out of her like a bubble machine
Sending floppy drunks off into a solid world

I stand on the other side and laugh sloppily 
I dress like a mess and digress
The girl in the activists dress tells me I am 
Spiritually bypassing and I nod my head reverentially
As though she has quoted the bible at me

I take out my vitamin bible and wave it in the face of the activists
Vitamins are important, I tell them
Eat your greens and get more sun.

poems.title: Auto drape
poems.author: Yusuf Misdaq
poems.content:
Whoever has a house of happiness can
Undress in peace

Unravelling her warm swarming body  
Creating a gentle cyclone  
As small as her 
That swirls the room of  
     Wooden floor boards and  
               Warm yellow evening light

Such that the clothes fly away
Gently and respectfully
Landing atop a chair.   

Elegant auto drape 
Maximal

poems.author: Yusuf Misdaq
poems.content:
Smoke clears 
The lusty fight with time-suck
Eases away

We’re left with the calm sanguine of neutral day  
Excitement is far away and
One sits in a room beside the minutes of the hour
Nothing-inches forming invisibly upon us
Marking our still primed faces with  
Scars of humility

There’s no great dish or desert coming
And it’s not about the food or what you’ve got coming  

You won’t be coming anytime soon
And your tomb is as distant as your womb
      either side of a wide, white galaxy.   

Walk sober with plods in the dust 
Minor miracles like smoke in the air  
And your foot making a print upon the earth

.Who dares, wins.

poems.author: Yusuf Misdaq
poems.content:
No one sits in a room dreaming of you  
There has never been a better time to be off

Nobody sings in a shower thinking of you
What a page left to write in

Given that you’ve been emptied out
Your ship should be coming in

Given your lack of currency
It only makes sense that you would rise

Hug these blank skies firmly
Set stars alight with sexual sights and
Find an imaginatory giver of life within the khalee* night  

There’s opportunirisks worth jumping on
Rising wild stock that will wing you on

Walk through your perishing days — you will reach sugarlands

Arrivals will flush-full-fill you with gladness
Dizzy heights will caress you as
Gentle winds upon a mountainface

It's heart to know  
The promise of tomorrow.
poems.note: * "Khalee," Farsi, 'empty'

poems.title: We are the Beauty Generation
poems.author: Yusuf Misdaq
poems.content:
We are the Beauty Generation
Where we go, the jungles of flowers follow 
Lovers like us can’t get cramped 
We create space and justify  
Magnetizers  

We dance into it gleefully without
Being overly guarded  
Into the guideline-seed.   

We drive daintily 
Wobbly-ly
We act like children
We fight lightly 
Just patting  
And we always return.

Who’s got the better of us? 
A deal won’t break us 
We’re beyond money
We’re beyond money.

We’re beautiful
We’re the freedom generation  

We won’t go anywhere 
And we’ll turn into beautiful old people 
And the boring young farts that follow 
Yuppies and token pseudo hippies
Will seek us out
Intrigued by our glowing sense of satisfaction with the present moment 
Attracted by the articulation and pronunciation of our  
Floppy happy 
Pumping

We spread ourselves like jam upon a  
Toasted belinda pacifica.

We’re allayed and  
in a pale moon
We’re swayed.

Every one of us is gay and
Aflight  

Touch us if you can.

poems.title: Spirit Suggestions
poems.author: Yusuf Misdaq
poems.content:
Ply yourself with spirit suggestions
Stay home all night with God
A candle on your prayer mat
A comfortable stillness where
No pretenses need be had
Worn or smiled

As serious and real as your heart is 
Upon your face.
      Coming out of your chest-thoughts.
          Pure moments of original
        Force

             And thunder.

poems.title: Sunday Morning
poems.author: Yusuf Misdaq
poems.content:
I feel a breath upon my shoulder 
A curtain falling
A voice from beyond that used to say
You can do it
Now saying run for cover

I feel the vibraphone moan
In my basement 
I make the sounds and all  
The songs that voice encasement 

I love the loathing  
Love the living  
Living testament 

The taste test is  
.How it feels.  
Put on parchment  

My mother sings
My mother cries
My mother leaves me

My father brings
My father takes
My father weaves me

I’m in it for
The long haul
There’s no point stalling

I’ll go out screaming
Or live fighting
There’s no moody-lighting

It’s a basement
It’s a dark and holy placement

There’s only me
On my carpet  
Look into my void

It’s a basement
It’s a dark enlightened place

I sit with candles  
n’I start to see
The beautifulest face

poems.title: The Beautiful
poems.author: Yusuf Misdaq
poems.content:
Look! At all of these people. 
They are full of sweet beauty! 
None of them know 
As they glide on autopilot 
Which is another way to say 
Live with instinct, soulfully

As these years, fives and decades fall off our shoulders 
And our belly’s expand and 
Knowledge deepens

Movements turn us and
Tumult teaches us to keep 
Rising, swerving and coasting

Glittering across like the 
Pacific 
Priceless on a sunset soundless.

Awake in this dream 
Where abstract clouds calmly keep us. 
Where birds secretly make love in the public and 
Give voice to the current of joy which 
Slices through us in a day.

Dot-Dot-Purple and Palaces 
Says the starling in approximate translation. 
Star-Star-Chandeliers and Bread on the wind-ind-ind.

Awake in this dream of slow cars in the city, 
Shaking cups of Polystyrene 
Filled with pieces of silvered human-ness 
Transacted endlessly until they find their one true home.

In finding their way, they are touched by the trembling 
Unsure digits
The tools of a tree-like people who speak 
One true language

And yet constantly act as if they cannot understand one another, 
Cannot read eyes or intentions 
And need translators with turtle-tongues.

They are a good species.

Clean and caring; 
Made mostly of water and forgiveness.

Only a very small portion of them truly swim in flames.  

The rest are badly disguised dancers.

poems.title: The First
poems.author: Yusuf Misdaq
poems.content:
Que Que

Over your gravestone 
I am still 
Attracted. To you.

Or is it the life that you were filled with?
The strange jewels you kept inside
On loan, or a part of you
Who were also on loan 
Paying a rent
For your days of reflection and skincrystal and 
Glowing 
               mud
Luminescent as your traces of personality.

You chewed gum sometimes 
You did other Earthly things too
But without talking 
Without signing, so that one day
I could lay in the strange sun 
Sitting on a steel chair
And think about you

Wondering if you ever really existed
Trying to remember how it felt
When we held each other 
In that perfect shape

poems.title: A Day of Existence
poems.author: Yusuf Misdaq
poems.content:
The voice volvic revolving and vaping for fine 
Air of distinction. 
The feel thunder of frog-chorus and black stars 
Sperm spawn in the 
Sky of Eye 
The cut crater of care and unkindness in a stolen me-self. 
The egg-wonder of a round Earth 
Newborn to a child of daydreams

God, give me a cradle and 
Rock my head back to the timeless 
Sleep rhythm of newborn
Before world wide recognition
When any moment at all
Was okay to fall asleep into

poems.title: Ramadhan 01
poems.author: Yusuf Misdaq
poems.content:
Inner springs gush forth
And rain showers inside of us 
Our arable bodies give of themselves 
There is no end to what we may saturate 
Piscean stars rainbow across the sky of space 
From the pitch of birth           to the ink of rebirth 
Your mother carved you of Water, God and Greatness 
And on you she looks, for confirmation of what she knows.

poems.title: Ramadhan 02
poems.author: Yusuf Misdaq
poems.content:
Cherry Coal and Carbon Craters

Half smiles and hidden agendas 
Fall away now like a dissolving 
Tablet in Water.

We swallow down silence 
Everything seems sobered 
Suffering is leveled out 
As the day is stretched 
Across particles of patience

Rolling Pearls dance upon the Strands 
The chords twist and fresh fibres are 
Created

New angles nullify yesterdays pain-drops

The dawn drops hang with pride off a telephone wire 
Twinkling like last nights stars 
Telling of today
And the grey truths that will form to manifest

poems.title: Only to be with You and no-one else
poems.author: Yusuf Misdaq
poems.content:
As for an iftar
I prefer a quiet one 
Without the presence of any bloody bridge builders 
Shmoozers or politicians. 
If you want to build bridges, go to war zones 
And bring plenty of cement.
Don’t come to the Mosque smiling in your suit
With a gang of photographers and 
Second-rate reporters who will
Write the whole thing up
Just to prove that it happened and
Tick it off a check-list

Islam is unique to each country it goes to.
In Senegal, they play music more
In Mali, they make mosques out of mud
In Chechnya, strong, bearded men do soft, Sufi dances
And in the West, iftars are social networking opportunities
Never-ending buffets 
Part of government strategies to reach out to the Izlahmic world

But I do not want to be Af-Pak'd
Or healed
I do not want to join you on the acceptable side
Where every insecure fool thinks they know
Exactly what extremism is 
Nor do I want to laugh and socialise with you at this
Small and 
Tender time.

I wish to be alone 
And serious
And deeper in love
With the only one who ever matters

poems.title: COVID Brain Gof
poems.author: Yusuf Misdaq
poems.content:
My zanzibar crown
studded with blue corn and
pomegranate

my unjogged memory
sitting in a misty mind 
content at all
it cannot seem to find 

didgeridoos and rain sticks
     chocolate djembes 
       and eritrean 
        capsulets 
     love potion salt
   water taken with drunk
 fruits and sea-filled boots

forgotten trauma even my body forgot
 names and times I lived and
   won't ever get back 
     at least not now
in the present presence of 
  unfurled fog
       the foamy, forgetful grog
       the passive injected drug
       the bygone hug and
  I'm still sufficiently loved. 

I want not and tears are far away. 
Nobody holds sway
  I can walk into the day as 
    absent as a missing bluejay
     from the flock that
      no-one copped and
       time forgot. 

"Wake Up!' says mum, who wants my 
  material best-self. 

I know I might lose. Might
  not be a rich retiree
    But I sloppily like me 
  the foolish jiggery pokery of 
   my floppy fantasy 
     makes zenith sense to me

I came from a squirt of liquid
  I fall along the streets like water
    every day of me 
  a splotchy fucking 
     miracle! 

 To God, I think 
       it all 
makes sense.

poems.title: Fragilistic
poems.author: Yusuf Misdaq
poems.content:
Fragilistic
   Tenderloins 
  Mugwort possums
 Fleeing into the mountain crevasses.

poems.title: One Nation Under Exposed Extortion
poems.author: Yusuf Misdaq
poems.content:
Damage to the chameleon 
   A stone must be a stone 
    A liar becomes exposed
The emperor has no hoes. 
  The little king's data gets leaked
    Tiny princess blackmailed for the peek
  Every small one of us 
          come            undone

poems.title: I swear my phone is listening
poems.author: Yusuf Misdaq
poems.content:
Maestro-magic
  The telemundo particles take
    Center shape as my body 
     Dissipates _ a fizzing
      Vehicle of flowerlife 
    I rapidly spin my top off
   And my brain spills out 
       on the floor.
  People see how it works and 
   quickly realize it's nothing 
     unique or special. 

Sufis make the heart their focus

AI & Big Data can easily read our minds 
     because they are not the primary 
         means  of  receiving  signs
            & communication lines
                 from the Divine.

poems.title: Braindead Bimbos
poems.author: Yusuf Misdaq
poems.content:
Tendulkar meritorius 

  the famous men in grey 
   all lined up in some 
    graeco roman garden 
     posing with huge 
       balls of stone and 
         small willies of earth 
      whatever they said and stood 
     for must be great, they think. 
   But then again, maybe they were
  their generations biebers 
or hairless k pop stars

Maybe they were muzak
prozak
pro-vax
selfy kodak
they don't know that
they all blowback 
can't get the show back 
dead, and can't grow back 
graeco-pedos 
jocks in speedos 
gtfo you ain't real men 
standin around in gazebos
see those / hear those 
weirdos in   
fear mode
i smash the stone and make 
history, dont you know
im the only real
hero.
poems.note: Huntington Gardens Pasadena

poems.title: balls
poems.author: Yusuf Misdaq
poems.content:
six minstrels
accordian dunstan 

"five parts per million 
is nothing!" says the 
salesman for the 
  new cancer
"it's totally repeatable!" 
  he says enthusiastically 
   he loves repeatable 
  and consistent because 
    it helps him run more 
    smoothly

poems.title: The Line (upon which we all walk)
poems.author: Yusuf Misdaq
poems.content:
"I favour you,"
says the King to the princess

She is happy, 
                         but within her is a cap that drains 
                                                                        all excess 
                                                                       happiness 
For she knows that 
  As he favours her today 
    Tomorrow she may displease him
      And fall out of favour 
        And be of the 
          unselected.

poems.title: Untitled
poems.author: Yusuf Misdaq
poems.content:
I'm up in the jig tree

   I collect little dark berries

    each one is a lie

   I learn all of the lies

     then I use them.

poems.title: Naqshbandiyya tul 'Aliya
poems.author: Yusuf Misdaq
poems.content:
Majlis modernity 
  reacquiring a distant fade
from a dotted line
  drawing down. 

Resurrecting the broken prize
   everyone had left and 
     discarded

Inhaling the sparks and 
   dust in a beard
       of history 

Reconnecting the charts
   new Islamic figures
      in the stars.

poems.title: You lie
poems.author: Yusuf Misdaq
poems.content:
Liars lick my boots
Flattery cahoots
Liars tell me lies
The rain ain't wet, it's dry.

poems.title: Cycle, 2024.
poems.author: Yusuf Misdaq
poems.content:
Six time
The furthest red line
The secret party sign
Get all the puppets to fall in line
Tell that one there to now resign
We'll unseat and redesign
Switch up names and fonts it's Times.

poems.title: Astralab Spirit
poems.author: Yusuf Misdaq
poems.content:
Sea foam I'm
  less alone
A grey covering 
  a heavy dusting 
This ocean is useless
    But still better
than being miserable in
     a square darkness

My mother and all the 
   rivers that lead back 
        to her 
     That must be it
          Yes.

All the roads I cut
    All the branches I broke
  Every heart I slowly 
        crushed

The grey clouds of Brighton
The grey beaches and shores
  are all I've known, stone. 

         Surfers and 
  blonde baywatchers
        were always
 something between a        
    joke and a dream
      
Why should anyone be that happy?
    I wasn't a miserable goth
               stereotype in black 
 I was just normal. 
 Mouth closed, eyes open
          I blinked
      I thinked 
   I pottered around the house
 like a liberated little mouse
And then I slept
                             also like a little mouse. 

In my dreams, a Californian 
  paradise of luminous beings
     called Kal and Lily and 
       Zeke and Jake and 
         all the young names
           gathered at 
            the back of a
              jeep with 
          wind in their perfect
       hair and there they 
        met smiling with intent
         and in formulation of
          a plan for the 
           episode of life
  they were about to play out.
"This is a great episode," 
 says the narrator my mind. 

And the capsized wave of Pacifica
    crashed in the sky
       sending bursts of spray 
          into the ether 
    Creative God calls the shots
       God of creation
         and the jellyfish
          ooze into a 
           colorful move
            an oolong 
         that nobody ever sees
     God for God's sake
    the blind pulse of eternity
 - a string of infinite blue coral - 
       lights 
                      stretched   out
  all the way to Canada! 
      the fires ablaze 
        in magnificent 
           geronimos  
                if we     
         only have the 
      frequency codes
              to know 
  then the visions and 
             invisible
         ink will show 
           its writing 
             singing
           words are
     ringing out from
      moments under
              water

 Whoever falls for the pulse of peace
       will play forever in the 
        palace of cats
         where only 
             felines 
             recline 
            on pink 
                silk 
             pillows
        of lofty glows
           and soft 
       licking their 
              toes 
        their perfect 
             paws
    and wincing eyes
 the round little claws
the doors of 
       soft surprise. 

  Herein lay the tides
    and the waves of 
      neverending 
            story   
reversed backwards
and source sucked itself 
   back in again 
and folded itself into 
  an ikea cabinet called 
      my mind , and 
    by the time 
        I opened mine
    I forgot what I saw
      Like the jellyfish before
   And all the silly signs 
      like stop and don't walk
        and no u-turns (i ignore) 
   all suddenly became real 
           again in a silly         
    made up play called LA

    

       But then, later that
             day, I met 
           a real surfer 
            called Shea.

poems.title: No Mystery #2
poems.author: Yusuf Misdaq
poems.content:
Perhaps I will never again 
As much as I, and we 
Did for those years 
Of discovery

And if I don’t 
Ever again 
As much as we did 
I don’t know what I will do 
I don’t know what will become of me

In nearly all things
One can learn patience and moderation

One can work the career ladder
As the days turn to months and 
Paychecks blend into some
Warbling, unknown quantity of meaningless 
Money.
One will always have a foresighted approach if serious 
About some ‘thing’
Always wait with the eye on the prize
Patience is very easy with finance and career

But not with that

The body is not made to burn everlasting
And I cannot stand to think of 
Losing you
(Another like you 
Who would make me feel as 
You did) 
When once 
My body has 
 Begun to dry
  As it has been 
   All of these tiring years, post-you 

   Post-our 
                 Starship sailings 
                             Down the Niles of 
                                        Our happy hearts 
                                               Yearning for one another 
                                        As we row and row 
                             Sweat and grow inside 
                 Towards one another’s core 
   Where we 

Saw 

What we loved

Without it I’ll die forever
Without it, I won’t be free forever

Wherever and whoever you are 
Whatever form you take
From whichever crater you arise
And with whatever darkness you bring

                                                Come! 

                                            Find me out  

And soon

Make it soon!

poems.title: If
poems.author: Yusuf Misdaq
poems.content:
If you run sweating and desperate in the morning sun 
Don’t let it be for a bus. 
Let it be for me.

If you come home at night and cry 
Don’t let it be for the job. 
Cry because of me. 
And cry to me.

If you come out swinging and 
Burning 
Let me have been the cause.

If you are broke
May it all have been spent on me and not wasted.

If there are any rivers left in the side of you
May they all run swimming back to me.
poems.note: Source: Unoriginal Prayers for Desperate Men (Nefisa UK, 2015). Out of print

poems.title: The Fall of Love
poems.author: Yusuf Misdaq
poems.content:
A yellow explosion of goodness occurs in the hearts of everyone 
And the world is yellow

Warm red cells are like glitter 
Twinkling in a yellow wonderland

We are parts of this exchange
We are moving without eyes
We are red on the outside
But yellow within

The heart is a halo
Above our red throb-rubs
The heart is a yellow oxygen-glow
Giving us gifted hope in a 
Tomorrow that lacks 
Rigidity

A tomorrow that encourages 
A turning of us 
Into abstract beauty

Into the all of love
The arms of love
The call of love

The Fall of Love
poems.note: Source: Unoriginal Prayers for Desperate Men (Nefisa UK, 2015). Out of print

poems.title: Instinct & Destiny
poems.author: Yusuf Misdaq
poems.content:
Where the heart goes 
   Lower-level lovers like I follow.

Who has the brazen, shined
   Arrogance to oppose 
      The Majestic Heart?

I am a fool, but even I am incapable of such 
Pure illogic.

I follow the silent path
   and gentle candles begin to flicker up quietly 
on both sides.

Dream hints 
     Half-hallucinated affirmations
   saying, 
            “You’re going the right way.

Keep on trusting in this.”
poems.note: Source: Unoriginal Prayers for Desperate Men (Nefisa UK, 2015). Out of print

poems.title: Freshwater
poems.author: Yusuf Misdaq
poems.content:
Lovely Overlord 
    LoverLord

Apportioning tablet 
That I’ve swallowed

Who knew me dissolved and 
Who knows me evolved. 

   .Garnisher.   

Gravemaster and 
Sparker of all monumental undertakings.

Raiser of me from sleep
   Out of bed and 
       Into a newater life. 

Freshwater
poems.note: Source: Unoriginal Prayers for Desperate Men (Nefisa UK, 2015). Out of print

poems.title: Untitled
poems.author: Yusuf Misdaq
poems.content:
Say nothing
Nothing needs anything
Be the droplet 
Drop everything

poems.title: Do you want Happiness or not?
poems.author: Yusuf Misdaq
poems.content:
Corporeal Crescent carries 
Waves that wander hither 
‘pon the upperdown clouds 
And the drifting darlings

Do you foresee the forever-a 
Fountain? Far upon the Isle 
So long and misty

Can you behold the eternity 
Moment? Lost in a scene that you 
Will remember

Give up the hand-held things for current 
Creation is a thought-pulse 
Peace away.

Flood up the heart for a risky deep-dive 
A risk-free bee-hive 
The sting of a bubble-dream

poems.title: Untitled
poems.author: Yusuf Misdaq
poems.content:
Comemama seeme 
Seeme climb the mountain! 
Seeme run so fast 
Seeme try an’ impress you.

Here, baba, look 
Look the man I been 
Look the sweat I sung 
Comesee the things I done.

But what I do when no 
Body is looking? When no 
Body is clapping? When no 
Body reacting?

Where I go when I’m all alone? 
When the stillness-silence 
Is a sinking stone?

poems.title: O my love
poems.author: Yusuf Misdaq
poems.content:
Let’s walk this line of courage together 
We can make it together 
Tangled in sweaty hand & heart 
Two triangles, twinned & total’d 
Turning towards the rising horizon

You and I to form a teamwork 
Of dreamblocks 
Upon this desolate scattering 
Of concrete need 
Of deep, deep want.

Let’s kiss this broken world morning 
                                                         together.

We can make it together.



Source: Lefke Automatic / Destiny of Love (Nefisa UK, 2013). Amazon

poems.title: Fountain of Water
poems.author: Yusuf Misdaq
poems.content:
Atop the fountain 
It bubbles and 
Tumbles over itself 
Spills inside itself

Constantly reaching and 
Failing, continuously

Forever failing 
Insufficient always

Trying!

Forever young 
Because 
Trying!

Here lies a life lived well.

poems.title: When love visits
poems.author: Yusuf Misdaq
poems.content:
Forage, Misdaq
piles languish
in the studded caves
thud bottom.

Rectangles make a shape
imitating the weather tonight

Your eyes do the same
when you look at me

Break open the bowl
you will see and I
what custom
liquids we
have

In our smitten
tide pool
we drive
together, out
throughly
truly and
bravely

a smudge for the unridden wave
there’s gold on the whitecaps
gold running out of the taps
God-given calm in our veins
relaxants not leaving our drains
palatial participation strums
the gay royal fool and jesters
calm my unbridled nerve ends

Creativity, says the musician
floods all of one's character
there is just the art of God
besting itself throughout
our cavernous escapes
pulsing through every
bud and cellular
flower tone
within

Our bodies are filled with
butterflies and
we feel this truth
when Love visits us

poems.title: Curatorial documents
poems.author: Yusuf Misdaq
poems.content:
Curatorial documents 

If given in 
The wind 
             cries sallow 
Cherished renderings

The far shore 
Found wandering 
Continuum dark hour 
Fire spark in the 
Blackest power

Overturning itself in 
Crusts for new 
Dawn uprising 
Wave spill

Droplet 
into 
Mass

Message 
from 
Messenger

Firey stain of 
Warm love 
that lingers

Generations 
Move through 
Me

poems.title: Literal
poems.author: Yusuf Misdaq
poems.content:
1

Time has gone.
Sad stories have no place anymore. 
You must accept and allow what has gone to be gone. 
What you did, what you wish you had done better, all are passing into destiny. 
What you are, you have been meant to be. 
You must open yourself to new possibilities. 
A new day must happen upon you. 
A new hour must awaken you.

2

Where you have been carries no credit or weight 
Nor does it count against you.

...a child of today...

You must bow your head and pray
However it is you actually do this 
It is a humble moment of acceptance
Submission 
                     Reliance 
                                     on
                             only 
                                   One

poems.title: Bismillah
poems.author: Yusuf Misdaq
poems.content:
Bismillah explosion
The purpose-world of magnitude opens
Reacts upon us
Detracts the us of us
Turning us to Ebbing
                                   Oceanways

Well we go
Down into Darkness

Well we go
Down the Tunnel

Well we go
Alone
Where we came from.

poems.title: New Man
poems.author: Yusuf Misdaq
poems.content:
New Man.

Whoever has an egg in their heart 
Shall have an egg in their stomach 
Whoever has an egg in their stomach 
Shall give birth. 
Whoever has a child 
Shall become an egg again 
That hatches anew

New man.

poems.title: The Royal We
poems.author: Yusuf Misdaq
poems.content:
Parallel mansions
While I run on empty
Someone is fueling me up

I turn away from the cup that’s empty
Brown coffee specks dried like some shitty history

A rich leather bound volume of mans exploits in 2022 is what’s needed and what I’m speaking of.

A people’s spiritual history 
Its many phases, 
The revival
The uprising
The rebellion to the revival
And the pure newbirth from the purest newborn mother

A kind of constant pregnancy in our culture 
Dying and denying and squirming awkwardly and 
All the while, in so doing, confirming what needs to happen to 
Live the next stage up in 
Truth and 
Courage

Dark points us to the answer

Artists and poets speak these words in code
Undercover police try to shut us down by
Not giving us enough likes or unfollowing 
But we laugh and say “what?
Instagram?”
Get the fuck outta here.

Our microphone and platforms are the winds of God 
That stir up in the emptied mountain valley of our beings

We’ve gone to the empty lands to receive what
God has always given to the empty faithful
Our hearts burn in solitude like the bush on Sinai 
We burn away 
Our lives 
Flames of outreach 
Flames within 
Flames of destruction 
Flames on fire on the feathers of our flight 
Burning with each fan 
More fire the higher we fly 
Atmospheric sub stratosphere blazes 
Taking us to into the spacial realities of our 
Divine heart

The pain a procedural necessity for us 
To view this awe-full starry expanse 
And receive the newest knowledge 
The newest news 
From the garden of truth.

poems.title: Untitled
poems.author: Yusuf Misdaq
poems.content:
Figurines marched beyond 
Into all of it, the misty legend said 
Five or six beams of light 
And they were gone 
Swallowed up entirely by the sky.

poems.title: History
poems.author: Yusuf Misdaq
poems.content:
Forevermore their names were spoken
 Some with reverence, others with scorn
   For what do legendary ones have but the
        Opinions and interpretations of history by
           Amateur fishmongers to sustain them? 

And the fish slopped around wildly

poems.title: Back in the EU
poems.author: Yusuf Misdaq
poems.content:
Chrysanthemum moonbomb 
Mon cherie took me out at Christmas  
We danced the debonair waltz 
She fed me pie in spoons 
And all was well, we swapped 
Fluids by the door after a warm  
Embrace and everywhere there were 
Laughters and sweatied hands.

poems.title: Artists Story
poems.author: Yusuf Misdaq
poems.content:
“Don’t sit so still!” I feel to tell all  
But all don’t listen and their  
Lack of motion speaks as loud as the silence of a guilty one.

There’s inertia. 
We’ve been so lulled to sleep  
That constant motion, while sounding nice 
Is a practical impossibility to most of them.  
So I don’t say it aloud 
For I know only madmen or whining moralists would shout

I try instead to be the blur I wish to see in the world
And my echo trail leaves behind it a sort of
Spiritual watermark that only comes together
Years later 
When the tenor and tone of the world has shifted  
To amicably receive me.

This has been the story of all the artists.

poems.title: With Feeling
poems.author: Yusuf Misdaq
poems.content:
Some have said 'no it won’t be so.' 
But it's always been exactly as I felt it 
The good thing about feeling is 
You can say nothing and still  
Be right.

poems.title: Miranda
poems.author: Yusuf Misdaq
poems.content:
Piss in the alleyway   

Until it all drains away  

*

I knew a man called Michael and  
We were in love  

We kissed under the rocks and  
My eyes sparkled when I looked at him  

He wasn’t handsome but  
I loved him and we  
Glad tided together for years  

He played my piano perfectly  
He was sensitive enough  
Made me sing and spin  

*

Miranda became Miranda 
When Miranda was in love

poems.title: Emergency Exit Row
poems.author: Yusuf Misdaq
poems.content:
When they ask if I am willing and able to do this or that in the case of an emergency, I lie. 
This is one instance where I lie. 
I will try to remember this for the next time 
I need to remind myself that 
I am a liar.

poems.title: Manifestover the Moon
poems.author: Yusuf Misdaq
poems.content:
Selling off 1st Editions of my latest fresh skin to the 
Gullible Lovers of Earth who want not, but for a 
Single touch of sincerity
And that, that I will give them

With bleeding pleasure
                                      My goods and my clots
In all their drippingness
All their fathomless atomness

Who but me shall fall upon my sword?
Who but me shall melt their reward?
With dirt rising all around, who but all of us shall 
Take out spoons and shovels and
Slide out the invading forces?

The faux-bohemians
The flaccid dignitaries
Who seek to lull us under their control
To take us by sleep
By their slow calculated approach to 'the dilemma'
To brand us as we dream
Whereupon we awaken as slaves
To an alarm clock
                         A tie
                                A commute
                                                  And a fake laugh for 

                                               Foolish ambition



Still sleeping,
                       we are !

And thank God for that ! 



2008. Washington D.C.

poems.title: Now
poems.author: Yusuf Misdaq
poems.content:
These twinkling nights are like daydreams as I sleep and scheme to pull out my pockets and release the goblins and dustbins and paraffin. If I don't let the world have some of my insides then how boring would the world be? I must induce this happy vomit. So must you. must must. 

Set it on fire and reject it. 

If we all danced like criminals and insane people then one day we might taste the salty air of the sea, we might be on one of earth's edges feeling free. If we all forgot who we were. 

And somewhere under the moonlight of the timeless night somebody played 'Stand by Me' by Ben. E. King on crackly speakers over an old wooden boardwalk by a warm beach. The romantic strings of innocence and experience. The religious words of love. And a child like me walked past with family and remembered the moment for the rest of his adult life; and a couple stood inside one another, leant on some gate and inhaled the same style of love, they felt the moments tide reach up to their necks and drown them; and a lonely young man nearby was all destroyed and burnt inside as he cursed the earth; and insects moved around them all, keeping everything constant and continuous and connected.

poems.title: Wage Slave
poems.author: Yusuf Misdaq
poems.content:
This is no way to spend the future
Unmended and medicated
Routine'd into silence
With no Coltrane running through the heart

This is no way to dive into tomorrow
Hesitant and filled with fear
Hanging on for dear life
To the secure bullet

.I must be let loose.

Somebody must make the zoo wild again
Let the rain fall in the living room

And my many children must appear in their multitude
Strung out as a laughing pearl necklace between my two 
Accordion palms

poems.title: The Building (Up)
poems.author: Yusuf Misdaq
poems.content:
Relinquish your rights to property
Ownership of hearts and 
Lawn mowers.

You've not been made to cash in
Claim refunds or rebates. 

You've been made to empty out your slop buckets
And gush off the waterworks,
Liquids, pipes, pressure and valves. 

You've been made to totally fall apart.

poems.title: Untitled
poems.author: Yusuf Misdaq
poems.content:
What’s the sense of it all?
What’s the shiver reality?

What’s the canonized recital
The Copernican credulity
The siren buffer
The tangled stone
The walking home
The black glasses
The salty pepper
The fertile doctor
The tongue and tongue
The Universes

poems.title: Untitled
poems.author: Yusuf Misdaq
poems.content:
Fluttering acceleration of birds to
Flickering candle existence

poems.title: Roots (What you are made of)
poems.author: Yusuf Misdaq
poems.content:
When I was born
With the movement of water running through me
God promised me victory
If and only if
I would never turn my back on the sea.
Never lift my heart out of the water.

poems.author: Yusuf Misdaq
poems.content:
Don't hold me so tightly
Don't lock in absentia
poems.note: From Frozen Fountain (2008). Out of print.

poems.title: Why poets are shit
poems.author: Yusuf Misdaq
poems.content:
Carefully considered
Mileage counted
Satellite rotations and
Tidal tributaries return
Sea fallopian ocean
Measured in turnstiles
Clicks and taps

Sunnysides up but
Leaking orange
Vernacular

Pride of the pilot is
Daily sunning
But the tan
looks 80's
and he
looks
not worthy
of anyones
trust or love. What

A lousy son you have been
said the guilt trip.
I can't believe you're the same
one I raised, you must be a
russian spy or something, said the
lack of medication.

They must have switched you at birth
said the soft mind.

Everyone talks too much and this is why
Poets are shit.

poems.title: The line
poems.author: Yusuf Misdaq
poems.content:
My husband likes the ham cheese croissant.

May he live forever
Purple and gold stars
A King sat upon his scone
He rules me entirely
I relent unto him
I give everything to him
He is my King I love him

All those other dumb bitches don't know what love is

poems.title: Meaning
poems.author: Yusuf Misdaq
poems.content:
Don't be afraid of meaning
Don't run scared from the whispering voices
Your heart reaches out
And speaks every moment

poems.title: Fajjr with dad
poems.author: Yusuf Misdaq
poems.content:
In a warm dawn
On a huge carpet in a forest
Outside a house
Praises are breathed into the air
The hanging, honeyed air.

American air.

And the distant neverending rumble of the almighty highway
Miles away
Bounces back to us as
Bass-whispers from the
Trusted trees

poems.title: Kind old men wandering New York City with slippers in Winter and the cold gets in and they are all alone
poems.author: Yusuf Misdaq
poems.content:
Crime uncaring
Coldness crime
Candles of confusion
Burning backwards

Prizes loaded
Happiness hangs
Heavy happiness
Whoever had it?

Whoever came first?
Creative contracts
Calm Cardiologists
Hearts attacked

Whole under threat
Particles run
Rage is wet
Dripping angry sun

Dropping dung and diamonds
Just the angle of eyes
Just the Season of soul
Is what determines a prize

Cries
         Uncaring
Coldness cries
Catalogued courage

Give us
         Gold & Freedom

Give us family footsteps
Mothers and fingers, filling
Care with convoys
Of Love that lingers

Pungent
Still in the air for years long

Rolling
In through our lives like old songs
Like old songs
Like old songs
Stay for sunset

Stay for sunrise
Stay 'til I'm Gold and I close my eyes

Stay for sunrise
Stay for sunrise
Stay with my neck and my heart's the prize

poems.title: LACMA
poems.author: Yusuf Misdaq
poems.content:
Excedrin ballast
Figures to be
A key growth indicator
For strapped humans
Pumping upwards on
Caffeine, dildos and kale
In the wellness revolution
That forgot God.

poems.title: Disquiet
poems.author: Yusuf Misdaq
poems.content:
"Feel free to chime in,"
Said the man who
Had such little
Calm within him
That he could never
Let a bell echo
All the way
down to
Silence

poems.title: True Lovers / Tulab al-Haqq
poems.author: Yusuf Misdaq
poems.content:
kind
professor

kind anyone who
dedicates their life to it
giving up their tendencies
t'ward genocide and gathering
  (sub-routines of the greed function).

kind, anyone who agrees to not make all
rivers lead back to the glory of them.

rather, they reflect, with a pocket mirror
every glint that comes their way
telling all who will listen
that the real glory is in
this higher than them
field of awe, which
they clumsily
spotlight.

poems.title: Out Front in the Western Village
poems.author: Yusuf Misdaq
poems.dedication: For Molly Qerim, Jenny Taft, Joy Taylor
poems.content:
I run a flame
selected from my
chime palette

touch it
upon the furniture
everyone is afraid
to stain

this is how
you rename
your daughters
I tell the villagers
as I cup the bird
in two
warm hands

hold it aloft
(the key is
above yourself)
and with the give of love
i say to the villagers
"hear her song!"

a beautiful voice
silences all
who twist
and shout.

poems.title: Blueberries before sunset
poems.author: Yusuf Misdaq
poems.content:
Slow
Go slow into the warm dark pasture

Envelops you and surrounds you
Its texture is smooth and velvet.
Space without stars.

Soft
Be soft
In the tickling night
The glint of light is a loudest whisper

Vesper, vesper,
Maghreb, vespers
Vapours swarm as a storm of
Openings

Perishings

Peaces

Latitudes

Openings

*

Bead by beautiful bead

Dhikr'd head-first into Heaven

poems.title: Hiroshi san
poems.author: Yusuf Misdaq
poems.content:
Carefully
You've done it all
Before
We look back
You've made us
A carpet
We can look
Forward
As a family

poems.title: Essence of Islam
poems.author: Yusuf Misdaq
poems.content:
Dig into the notion

It shivers when touched
like you

Precious crustaceans
drenched in fresh waves
cling to rocks
and abide.

A slow blinking
giant turtle
  is
the aged essence of
submission.

Breathe in slow
and let the air out
controlled
with a hiss
of humanness.

Cars and nervous
followers
cannot unseat you
when you're lost in this
tranquilness.

Bereave the rank death
that seeks to drag you
under before
your time.

The returning waves of time are
counfounding all
childish notions of
linearity

A renewed
trust in the
certainty of
eternity

poems.title: Visions of the One
poems.author: Yusuf Misdaq
poems.content:
There is, in you
A fine patience for
Rivers
Still as you (certainly)
Surge t'ward me.

And in I:
– A recently done storm –
My vapours run
Wildly still, sometimes
Straying and searching
From the concrete cuts.

It is the fact that I'm here
In this city of non-believers
That I am not a river.
That I have not the stillness
Not the vision to see you.

poems.title: Khashang
poems.author: Yusuf Misdaq
poems.content:
Is it possible to stay open and re light
the gentle fire?

Smooth flowing doves
Mixed into the soup of air
Lift wishes upon the sky and
Reconsider the distraught and
Painfully touched ones to be
In need of love not more
Loathing.

poems.title: :) Give 2 Live :)
poems.author: Yusuf Misdaq
poems.content:
Jindana

L'vever arrival

Hit runway gliding
Making it all a question of timing
Falling in your favour
Like times you win
And the glad handers
Come rushing in
Towards you

.Gravitone.

Don't plunder this
Short-lived blooming
Mind warns body
Mind warns soul

Soul warns body
Soul warns mind.

Everything distributes
Another way to say
 Fades.

Everything falls into
Appropriate pockets
Another way to say
  Falls apart.

What conscious heart
Throbs and radiates

Asking to receive or
Willing to give?

Latter lets you live
Latter lets you receive
As though autumn leaves
Swirled up from dead earth and
Reinforced your armourtree to create
A wonderful new summertime of you and for you.

This is how you live the high life of surfers
An' forever-youngers

By not bundling everything in to
Your own back seat.

By not taking all of the winnings
'n by leaving a few spaces open
poems.note: Source: Ressurection Mag, April 2020. Link: https://resurrectionmag.com/2020/11/01/give-2-life/

poems.title: Sentence
poems.author: Yusuf Misdaq
poems.content:
Perhaps one day, you'll know what it's like to feel
Distant from the blood in your own body.

poems.title: We Know Nothing
poems.author: Yusuf Misdaq
poems.content:
Where mirrors come
Stillness leaves

Where leaves fall
Stones firm up

Where love dies
God pulls the strings

When cats cry
Humans are sleeping

When humans sleep
Cats are crying

When stones break
Leaves grow

Where God strings
Love dies

poems.title: My life
poems.author: Yusuf Misdaq
poems.content:
Sitting very still
On a horse that is running very fast
poems.note: Source: My Love is for You (2007). Unpublished collection.

poems.title: Untitled
poems.author: Yusuf Misdaq
poems.content:
We sat in the sun,
Together, apart.
Two little spiders of love
Each in our own corner.
Small but brave
And beautifully patient.
poems.note: Source: My Love is for You (2007). Unpublished collection.

poems.title: Tender box
poems.author: Yusuf Misdaq
poems.content:
There's a tender-box,
Warm-heart-wrapped,
Delicate and for no-one,
Sitting above time.

Untouched by human love-songs,
Too complete in its beauty to 'unravel' or 'bloom'
Or 'give' or 'take'.
It lives on a few inches of never-melting,
Warm snow.

Sometimes,
It rises like a dawn and sets like a mountain.

This little tender-box.

All your nuances and quiet thoughts are inside it.
All the wonderful names that you could have had are in it.
And the high-spirit of elegance that's suggested
In your clean, long, horse-hair, is inside it.
poems.note: Source: My Love is for You (2007). Unpublished collection.

poems.title: Go On
poems.author: Yusuf Misdaq
poems.content:
go in!
don't stumble
you're a champion
winner of life

they will hand over the pile to you
you will gather it in your arms
it will explode into a colorful
celebration of joy tokens

and
     God knows you
                     will
have earned it with the
fights you lost remember
you got black eyes and
dark patches on your
skin which was meant
to be protecting you

God I know
              and that's why I'm foretelling
foreseeing and forecelebrating your
overdue victory

God you had
              this one coming
a wonderful arrival day
congratulations to you
for when it will soon happen
remember the poor ones
like me in your prayers of gratitude

poems.title: Scarcity
poems.author: Yusuf Misdaq
poems.content:
Prime members get anointed
With special oil

Your babies will get light
And discounted access to water

Hurry now sign up
Offer period ends soon

poems.title: Youth
poems.author: Yusuf Misdaq
poems.content:
Oh God save me from myself
The desperate eyes of well-dressed haggard old ladies at Panera dart around
Eager for some younger blood to
                                 suck slurp gurgle
                                           dribble
As compensation
For the total waste

For the complete ruin

Oh God, Merciful God
Do not deprive me to
Avail myself of the opportunity
Of worshipping You while
I still have a meaningful sacrifice to offer

poems.title: Right Place
poems.author: Yusuf Misdaq
poems.content:
Shah men
That's how we pray in the rain

I say six words that sound like
rotating hexagons
some visual perception trick online

Then you look back at my face
For grounding and confirmation
That this is really happening

I've broken through
I've broken through

The sounds and songs of the nice people I talk to
Are familiar scales on songs that I've sung or know
So well that I may as well have sung them.

I still search
Patiently now
For the new combinations of chord and rhythm

But when I'm with these fine folk
I search no more and service the need
