Everything is on pause but to hear
Their song and let it play with me
And let us play together in
The moment of toys and joys

Searching can wait until I'm alone
When my yearning is as serious
And silent as a grey stone

Comingling and joy falconeering
Must be given their full due
That is how we live the dance of the living
By giving.

~

Some poets don't like poems that rhyme
They are like those democrats who hated Trump so much
That they became nazis.

poems.title: My Conscience
poems.author: Yusuf Misdaq
poems.content:
Oh good god
Don't go
Don't leave
Though I asked you to

Oh, good-God
don't take her

I keep removing
parts of myself
like a monkey
picking up
monkey
from monkey

I keep saying no
to myself
and the conscience
of self that she
embodies.

The dog shakes itself loose
invisible dust goes everywhere

If she is my conscience
She is also my dust
My germs and yes
My poisons.

Poison isn't something
you get to vote
no on.

Poison is always something
that you're given

And there are
always reasons.

poems.title: Tech Debt
poems.author: Yusuf Misdaq
poems.content:
Geoplasticity encroaching
Cockroaching
Webanating

A connected world appears
With us paralyzed and awaiting predation
Facebook discontinued the "anything I can get" option a long time ago
Because it was too close to the truth of what we were destined to become
A desperate clan of poor villagers, once first-world thrivers
Having our money extracted so that machines can tell us
How we've slept and we can schedule the next
Stimulations.

poems.title: Multiverse 12 million and 6
poems.author: Yusuf Misdaq
poems.content:
Caravaggio
Mervene forenniffer
Mudjie told me I wasn't allowed to write
But I wrote a lot
And a avalanche came
Like me, tumbling into a multiverse
Where everyone's hair is always messed up
And there's no culture where people on tv look great
So we laugh like dorks when we see each other messy
Each morning, messy and laughing at the sillyness of ourselves
Our pillow hair on full display
The yellow stains of curry on our selves
'That one's a pen that leaked,' you say
Laughing, and she laughing too
'I have one on the back of my pants,'
She says pointing to her arse
'You should see it it's terrible.'

All innocent mistakes
They let the moment flow
Knowing they're not more important than it.

poems.title: Untitled
poems.author: Yusuf Misdaq
poems.content:
Cheer me up
Put a price on it

poems.title: Rider
poems.author: Yusuf Misdaq
poems.content:
Faradise
A dusty beach
The water all dried up
A black man with odd-shaped bald head, one quarter of it shining in the sun

Churrup
Foot in stirrup
Hya say rider
Hya !
No whip
Just passion of
HYA
Gentle digging of ankles
Two bodies in communication
Collaborating into motion
Man and horse
In a co-dependent fling
Firing off
                 for a few moments into heaven.

poems.title: Organic shop overpriced
poems.author: Yusuf Misdaq
poems.content:
Chime bells ting
All of our mothers
each sang once

That was how it was back then
When everything was frozen in gilded frames
We had simple-to-understand names

The games were fun

Like plastic hippos that were hungry
Or a stressed looking adult who needed an operation
Or invaders from space who had no threatening face

It seems at some point the stakes got impossibly high
And we freaked out
And felt it necessary to begin sticking it to one another
  And not with joy sticks

And the games were no longer 2 player
It's as if one day, we all just went off into our rooms by ourselves
And never came back out.
And even if the new games are multiple player games
And even if we can play with people all the way in Switzerland
The only game seems to be shooting off bullets
Carrying on our wars.

"But it isn't all that bad," say the mothers who sang once
Reminding us of grace and cardiology
"There's organic blueberry and
You can share your mix tapes with everyone in the world now,"

"But no one listens to them, mum, it was better before," I moan
Having a point, like all moaners.

"Don't live in the past," she says righteously
And then, from beyond the veil,
"Listen to your mother,"
Says dad
The man who regarded the 80's skyscrapers I hated
And said with sincere admiration
"Just look at that!"

What an accomplishment indeed, dad.
To welcome in every moment
Smiling at the mess
And mix it with your inner
Warm-milk
fluency

Languages are all paradox
Except when we nod in agreement
Brown me and brown you from
Different continents

And when we smile at one another
Men understanding men

And when we laugh our arses off
Fizzing spirits ascended beyond
Boiling point and
Noon-bathing in the clouds of Allah

poems.title: Plea
poems.author: Yusuf Misdaq
poems.content:
Oh my truth !

There must be better ways to you than making a complete fool of myself
But I am not skilled enough to access them
So I'll just sit here flapping my arms around
Making a dramatic show of myself while I slice
My mind into a million untrue stories

poems.title: DTLA
poems.author: Yusuf Misdaq
poems.content:
Chime in. check sideways.
  Palley around with those
    Big shots from outside of town.
         A crown, you'll get your dirty hands on.
                A shimmering Tuesday way
         To do what you do, yet again
    Face pressed up against the damaged glass
  A corner turned, a new glint in the angle
White truths form today
                    So clear you wonder how
               They didn't present themselves to you sooner

You want to shout out to the world
   That you've discovered the cure
  And resolved the equation of why
Streets get dirty and why dogs can
Sense sadness and everything under
This new sun.

                      All of the secrets
Yours for a temporary
   Dissolving moment.

poems.title: Slow Save
poems.author: Yusuf Misdaq
poems.content:
The rats have it!
We'll see how their term goes

Surely it will start with a reaching across the aisle
To destroy alliances and crush the defeated

I will stay under the bridge with the insane
There's a fire hydrant with one loose bolt
It leaks drips of fresh fire-fighting water
I place my bucket under it and slowly gather
Enough for a bath on Tuesday and
to wash my belongings on a Saturday.

Nobody will see my calm face
   The drinker of good water
       That quells the raging fires.

But perhaps they will feel me
   And my calm can calm others
       And my contentment can infect
          The discontented.

At the very least, I shall have
      Glasses of calm
              and still
                 water
           for myself

poems.title: Treasure
poems.author: Yusuf Misdaq
poems.content:
Good tiger
Alloysius megamen
   The fritz and tin-tin are done
  The boom and hollow remain
Still like rain
  The spirit of your father unchanged
 While the moody play mind games
You repose in prayer
                                    and hear
                     The eternal voice
                                   that
                                emanates loving.

Some poets are scared to say the obvious
because they are obvious.
They take a golden treasure chest and
   try to find its scratches in a vain
    attempt to sound interesting,
      while the hungry dogs like me
         wag our tails in joy at its
            Golden shimmer,
                        and lick it
                     in an attempt to embody
                        Goldenness.

poems.title: Miniature
poems.author: Yusuf Misdaq
poems.content:
Shitake gingerbread men
The tiny little men
Who run around being trained
And told what to bray
By busy-bodied shells.

*
Titular squeaks
Let the love be known
In miniature cracks
More expensive
Than a thundering love epic
The tastemakers know their power
They'll start selling oxygen.

poems.title: mmm, healing!
poems.author: Yusuf Misdaq
poems.content:
I'm outdoors with a beautiful yellow full moon illuminating the night sky.
I'm between two heaters, held warmly.

I'm an antelopes awareness
  My sensors are only effective because
My sensitivity is attuned.

   I'm a wound-up star-seeker
I don't need batteries to make me go
   I work by magnet;
What is for me, I'm pulled toward
  My sting only swipes when I'm blocked
    Or when you are stuck in the mud.

      My sting is wicked venomous
I've got gold spice in my poison
That's why you suck out my poison
   You know you need it.
      And your soul loves it.

So, come now,
  Have of my healing blood
      Liters of my dreams
           Will cure your blindness
                Gallons and quarts of my
                    gushing glug-glug is all
                         for you.

I've understood a long time ago the biological truth of
the hippy statement that we are one body, and that we
All bleed together.

poems.title: Versation
poems.author: Yusuf Misdaq
poems.content:
Dearest epistle upon my mistletoe
I write to inform you that the hitherto bedraggled burglar has been captured and we have him in our possession as though he were a kilo. What would you like us to do with him?
Sincerely,
Judge.

Dear Judge,
Thank you but I am utterly confused at your ridiculous question, what does it mean, and how on earth are you able to speak directly into my mind?

Dearest Yusufius,
As to your first question, it is a long story and involves your psyche, which also coincidentally answers your second question.
Begone,
Judge.

Dear Judge,
Not good enough. Explain more on both fronts.

Dear Yusuf
We caught a burglar attempting to break in to property that belongs to you, clear enough? Also, I am able to talk to you because I am a part of you.
Love,
J.

Dear J,
What was he trying to break into? As for the latter point, it feels true, I will sit with it longer before speaking on it.
Love,
Yu.

You clearly are a simpleton of simple tones, I bet your bedroom is painted pastel grey and you while away your days in worship of ephemeral haze.
Jiggy

How dare you rock my world. I'll have you know I'm a respected artist. I went to my cousins wedding the other day and she told me that all her friends call me her artist cousin, so you see, you have no grounds to judge me.
Yossle

I have every grounds to judge you, not only because i am a trump appointed judge from the biden era, but because i am one of the deeper parts of you, so for the last time, your protestations fall on deaf ears insomuch as they are falling on your own ears insomuch as you are arguing with yourself so you really are winning nothing except for the right to call yourself the most schizophrenic person writing on his laptop in this cafe.
Judge Judy

You're right. I admit it. It's easy to admit that you've got the better point (and that you are subsequently smarter than me) when I realize I am you and you are me
Yusuf

Exactly, see, that makes it easier for your vain dripping mind, doesn't it? You're not admitting defeat, you are celebrating your own intelligence ! Hurray for you ! You bloody earth dweller.
Jowels.

So anyway, remind me again why we're speaking.
Yu

There was a case of breaking and entering
Ju.

Who broke and entered?
Y.

You broke and entered yourself
J.

A part of me got into another part of me?
Y.

Very good.
J.

What part of me was it, and what part of me did it break into?
Y.

Now you're asking the right questions, eisenstein.
J.

It's Einsten, Einsten.
Yine

I don't make mistakes, and I got shhtyyle, Eisencrantz.
Jup.

Anyway let's stay on track, before my slow slash long covid-addled brain slips up again, as it is wont to do, remind me: what part of me broke in? And where did it enter?
Y.

It was the part of you that rouses you, the part of you that is a trainer, a coach, a motivator, a tough-love giver. That is one of the myriad beings that live within you. It is why you didn't find the old trainer in the original Rocky film to be particularly shocking as others did when they first saw the film, even when he was being extra tough on Rocky, you understood. Because a part of you understands that giving tough love and harshly delivered, blunt proclamations is at times the best way of showing or telling someone something that they might otherwise be blind to. In short, if it helps, think of that aspect of your psyche as an older Buster Meredith spewing difficult to swallow truths in a raspy voice that cuts through all niceties and gentle illusions.
Yours forever,
Judgeline Albright.

Okay so I understand now what person it was who did the breaking and entering. You didn't answer the second part of my question, which was, what part of me did they break and enter into?
Yu

I wanted to break up the dialogue so that there was space for the reader to breath since they are necessarily a half step behind us.
Jacques

Agreed. I am an artist and have noted all my life that the audience often lags behind, at least the first time they are interacting with an artwork.
Yasser

You are right brother
Jamil

Let us pray together, and the answer to the rest of the equation will come as it may, and we will stay open to it all, whether we receive an answer, whether life answers it slower than my slow covid, whether life says no to my request for an answer, or whether life answers it with a better question, and by life of course I mean the almighty force that lies hidden and present in all things, our Creator, who made this psyche to interspeak and this world of interwebbing technology and hearts that none can explain, the complexity of which no mind, not even the finest artificial mind, could ever begin to comprehend in its totality, save for our Creator, praised be its unknown Name.
Yusuf.

ALL: Amen.

poems.title: Woke Up!
poems.author: Yusuf Misdaq
poems.content:
I'm a digeridoo
A yoo-hoo
Flag me down
Iron print leopard pungent
Frisking over in the new age of reason
Unlocking ourselves from prison and
Downtiding to a risk-free religion\
Trophies for everyone!
No-oone will catch fire
Everyone safe from monsters
of our parents generation\
A new leaf
A new undergiver
A fine line
A chiseled, slapped-on freedom where
None can lose and
We'll keep quiet about winners. \
A figure 8 of avoiding hate\
A paper thin lake of ice, let's skate\
Our rich new country will last forever
Like the word bae
And shoulder pads. \
\

poems.title: Manicured poo-bums
poems.author: Yusuf Misdaq
poems.content:
There are so many of us who have grown brittle due to dependencies on our drugs. \nThe smoothest way to sail is blindly,
Each day responding, "I don't know," when
They ask what's on the menu... \nEach day, tapping the bare skin of your wrist
To show them you have no watch.\nEach time saying, "I can't read Japanese,"
When the instruction manual is being
Waved about like a crucified jesus. \nOnce a child learns something
They are ready to learn again
And their enthusiasm is currency doing
Well against the dollar. \nI'm the kind of person that's popular at house parties
Because I like to learn about what you do and to me
There's always an aspect of it that's interesting.\nI am not particularly interested in living for a long time
But it does become more apparent over the years
That the curious age best. 
\

poems.title: Clearing
poems.author: Yusuf Misdaq
poems.content:
Chirrabussa .
Saloomian . \
the fire of coughing\
the corruption that must exist
for a clearing to have meaning. \
\
Dec 9th, 2022. Los Angeles, California.\

poems.title: Avile Beach
poems.author: Yusuf Misdaq
poems.content:
pimple slow
luscious snow
charms in the heart to glow
chimes in the moniker mnemonic
music being sung by God all
I had to do was look outside
And every single thing I saw
Was code to notation, melody
(And rhythm, obviously).
\
That’s how I am
If anyone ever wonders.
I stare out like a dazed addict
Avila beach waves watch me and
Everyone somehow knows I’m not bad
And that poetry is what it is I’m typing out.
He’s not local, they know, but he’s no danger
He’s helping somehow, it’s not a bad thing, he’s
Doing.
\
Let him continue, say the people in a silent landslide vote,
Beautiful people who are always on the side of poets
In particular the polite ones who step gently. \
\

poems.title: Love Poem
poems.author: Yusuf Misdaq
poems.content:
Bird above
Bird within
As a bird
So pillow
Soft tiger
We wrestle in agreement
I feel myself with you
In you I become the silver bullet
With me I see you turn gold
Two of us hanging on the edge of old
A mountain we'll always have
Surrounds us and protects our dreams.\
You are honest and clear
Through a kerfuffle and a
Glinting, flashing mirror. \
I watch you asleep
You are glinting
Old demons try to stay
Old demons try to push in space for new cobwebs
But at this time of knowing you
All the walls are coming down
And your apartment is opening up into
a broad place filled with sunlight and sea air. \
Even your kerfuffles are
Straightening out into
Clear white lines
Boldly drawn. \
You're drawing yourself into new warm dawns
You're reaching in and
Finding white laughter
Where before old
Demons sat. \
You are awakening and
Stretching out
your child
sketching your
new baby
you\
Reborning yourself
your new form\
Nobody can take their eyes away.
Your father sees and knows it
But the external chronology
Makes it harder to verbalize. \
Any cute six year old can
say any old shit and
the surrounding world
swoons like a baby
just smiled. \
Not everyone can
Invent a new life
out of play and
healing. \
Rare is this glinting
gently dancing flower
called ______\
The mountains, the truckers,
The cups of coffee, the
Brothers and sisters
The failures and flourishers
Stare on unresolved
in admiration. \
Rare is she
Shining tigress
Prowling through the
mountains,
eyes crying for love
eyes aliving with dripping
always timeless beauty. \
.This is she. \
Such a woman is She\
Become unto herself\
A pride of creation. \
A feathery lover\
An undistressed mother. \
How lucky I have stood
to love her. \
\
Give me the strength to be inside sound
Give me the wisdom to remain in silence
And the instincts to know when to use the two
\
Don't be upset with me
The problem is
~And I keep telling people but they won't listen~
Or, it has begun to sound corny:
You all are stars
The twinkly emoji is reserved for special things
You know
What you are
But you are scared to think it
Say it
And if anyone acts like it
We label them with terrible words. \
It's true it may be hard for some to
Distinguish the line between
Pretentious ego maniacs
And Divine stars\
But that's ok
When I was about 12 or so, I was a smart kid
But I absolutely hated Prince
I thought he was so arrogant
I had no idea what a beautiful supernova he was
That his creations would ring like the bells of Allah
Punctuating the perfect moments of my life
Only those who love God far more than themselves
Can embody this rare form of stardom\
Jan 3rd, 2023. Los Angeles, California. \

poems.title: African-American Gymnast
poems.author: Yusuf Misdaq
poems.content:
Firing gymnast.
Flying across the gymnasium
On fire, flames shooting off her
As she does six backflips
And nails a perfect landing
Somehow
Nobody is asking why she is trying
And pushing so hard when she could be at home
Watching internet in her underwear. \
"It's better to burn bright,"
She tells the researcher with the microphone
Moments after the gatekeepers signalled their numeric
Backing of her energy. \
"It's worth the sacrifice I made," she said,
Her skin soon to be gone
In a short time. \

poems.title: Imperfect Man
poems.author: Yusuf Misdaq
poems.content: How many lies do you have to catch me in before you realize i'm in love with you?\

poems.title: Pain-Root
poems.author: Yusuf Misdaq
poems.content:
A tincture with pain-root
What's pain-root?
A sham of solidity
A true story
A new science to learn
A a. 

Sometimes, I smash the walls down
I curse the kind
Destroy the place of worship
And hug a demon
All so
balance returns
Let the dreary satisfied ones
Burn in the fire
fire of life:
- a reservation for the fortunate
- furnace of freedom

'Come here,' it's advertisement would claim
'And watch all your pain just
Melt away!'

And it's true, too.
Nothing will destroy your pain like more pain.
Two negatives multiplied
A child/age of prosperity
Tomorrow
Always sounds like
Such a hopeful, promising word.
"Tomorrow!"
to be said with eyes wide
Looking up at a fat universal sky
with ample supply of clouded beings and
shaded forgivers.

'Come!' sayeth our Lord God.
'Try my prayer and the breathing thoughts
I shall call "meditation!"
A fantasy dream
to give off
amber and scenic
route scents.

poems.title: Flotation
poems.author: Yusuf Misdaq
poems.content:
How many safety demonstrations have I ignored?
How many more will I get to ignore?
When will I die?
And will I ever get to
Blow into my lifevest
to top it up
Which is also a light
flotation device\

poems.title: Moment
poems.author: Yusuf Misdaq
poems.content:
ugly curmudgeon
changing his name in the jungle.\
Hot striking a new fire in the night
A pencil marks the darkness
Words of prophecy clear the air\
Bird lands on the index finger raised
No-one is making a point except God. \

poems.title: Some of them want to be abused
poems.author: Yusuf Misdaq
poems.content: My computer can make a computer generated image of me that makes me look heroic and wonderful but in reality I am just a tired old raisin talking the same old stale shit that ive already said a hundred times before, and i know im not that hero in the picture so why would i ever put it out there what a nerve now isnt that the biggest lie that’s ever been sold? I wish I could put a picture of me in my underwear and have my bad morning breath hit the viewer right in the face, that would be heroic.

poems.title: For-ahM True
poems.author: Yusuf Misdaq
poems.content:
Cinturies
My darling of ever
On the green eves
In the leaves
We'll set the degrees
Push a green pattern into me
from God's transparent window
where new creations move in ascending forms
that you see becase you value source. \
Push that green hex onto me
My chest receives
No spell or thing from you
But a gift you went in for
Plucked for me from
l'jardine astrale \
We understand don't we
Where hands must go
to retrieve constantly
Change agents or empaths
or deep sea divers
what difference, words?\
Change your face and I will still recognize you
You me.
So let's meander
sans agenda
in the auburn hills
as time fades and
our spirits laugh at time.
\
I'm you, I'm true
My last name is my first name
And it's yours\

poems.title: A Perfect Poem
poems.author: Yusuf Misdaq
poems.content:
Pem
Ussing, everywhere !
A gem
everywhere ! \
Women shooting out life
Mudslides and diamonds
Into the receiving palms of a happy child
Christmas present, new toy, little brother\
Some are given such a profound responsibility at such an early age
My big brother perhaps wonders why I honour him so
He doesn’t know that I know
How his 3 year old self
Touched my hand and
Loved me like a mother\
Sem
pure simple
responsibility\
We’ll look after it
The things we’re given
Do as we’re told
Take care of our family\
Selflessly
premming
Ussing and binding
Togethering and swervedly re-forming\
An excellent humanity
humbly obedient to its programming\
Going into age and time and life
With the edges smoothed
By obedience to form\
And in the honouring of forms
Do all poets find freedom from
Sets and dawns. \
\

poems.title: During Class
poems.author: Yusuf Misdaq
poems.content:
Who is the Lover?
And who do you love?

poems.title: Conkers
poems.author: Yusuf Misdaq
poems.content:
File it in palindromes
Pale homes have felt filtered.
Unripe parsely can't be chopped
Only admired and loved. \
When you're too young
Don't call yourself an artist.
I didn't.
And I'm better than you. \
When you've just started out
Remember how wonderful it is to be a student.
I do. And I never forget it. \
Sing free of likes
Sing free
Sing badly
Sing strangely. \
Nobody who likes you will ever like you. \
Unless you love you.\
You cannot love you
Until you have fallen
Disappointed yourself. \
You're holding onto a sandcastle. \
I am too polite to tell you this
Outside of poetry\
When I see you I smile kindly and
Wonder what form your eventual breakdown will come in\
I hope you know I'll be there in spirit
And that that time will be your greatest asset
Though you will wish it away
You won't be able to avoid it.\
Richard the Lionheart
They’d call me
If I was Rich \
As it is I slink by in
Coal delight
“Nice guy!” they say
After meeting me
At house parties
(And mean it). \
I giggle, times I
Overhear that
(Or overhear
Echoes of it) \
Por que \
They don’t know
I think giggling
The glowing
Light here
~Chestaline~
Growing from within
as a Library in
God's Palace \
Such to expand the clouds \
Angels and choirs
Sing of what’s
Come free inside of me. \
Richest gradient and
Supple milk
Splashing in a
Milk Sea
I’m riding
To the moon \
Screws loosened
Structure disassembled \
I am the free us
The first last
Of Universes. \
Standing at the crossroads
Pulling some near
And making others wait. \
* \
I was the far off being
Who was near you
I found happiness in
The run. \
This feeling has gone from my heart to my deeper heart.
It lies there in secrecy.
The main heart has become an accomplice to lies
It protects the feeling that says save me
It hides it, covers it from me
Trying not to let me see
So I stay running on
This wheel and
Never make
The call to
Confront
My past
And say
I’m sorry
I will always
Love you. \

poems.title: Transmission
poems.author: Yusuf Misdaq
poems.content:
High chime,
Aquiline
Slice thru the time
Slide thru the pines
I’m one with the mind 

Golden sun thuds onto dead concrete
Everyone walks upon a golden street
The empire buildings either side of us are our wings
Each tiny brick of them would fit in the palm of our hand
Here we stand with the spirit of God within us
Awaiting the reality of this self-awareness
To catch up with us in the years before
We fade away

poems.title: Open Sesame
poems.author: Yusuf Misdaq
poems.content:
Rose garden, I’m stuck 

Sometimes the details don’t matter
I’m not scared of the shady
Secrets, the dark corners
I noticed 

I sit with her and notice that
The most impossible equations
Resolve in her eyes

I should know better than this
I’m a far-sighted man, yes,
I’ve traveled the heart
Ski’d toward horizons
That looked distant and daunting
Soon became as familiar
as my own
warm palms

I’ve gone everywhere and now
I feel like a child again
“Let me show you what I can do,”
This funny immature voice within me
Wanting to impress
her
quiet queen eyes

I laugh at the voice and
Push it aside.
My history book
My wholeness of being
My confidence
Get back into the drivers seat
Grabbing that wheel
Steadying this ship
Man, like.

But
then her eyes keep talking
More pieces begin
Dissolving and
It feels nice

I’m stuck in a rose garden
Trapped in honey moment
Gone in cherry skies
Upward
in her camomile eyes

True love is to be born again
Resetting into a pool of
Dual origin

poems.title: Splendid
poems.author: Yusuf Misdaq
poems.content:
Come in, she said.
Go on, she said.
You should, she said.
You can, she said.
I will, she said.
I will. 

Her hot will
Awake by a
Hot candle
Burning the night
A passionate 23 with
Neon eyesight

poems.title: Andean Transmission
poems.author: Yusuf Misdaq
poems.content:
Cranberry Regulus
File out of the shop in
Single file 

Bells collide and make
Marks upon the
Folded prerogatives.

Sine waves jumped
Up and bit
Peruvan perritos
Too high up
Andean
Cumulus
To be
Any
Threat.

Something about the altitude
Said the man with a nose shaped like a
Hawk, an impressive man, to be sure
He let the doors all be open as he spoke
Acknowledging every movement of wind
And distant car horn as though it were all
A part of the conversation.

It was beautiful said the woman carefully
Studying his face. 

It’s all a response with them, said Jahangir
Who had just been dumped
They don’t have any originality
Stupid women !
But the truth was the goods he had brought to the table were weak as fuck
She just let him know about it.

Fire them all
The caretaker took his keys out
Opened the office door and sat inside it
Weeping by the little sink which was reserved for the dirty water of mops
His tears went down the same dirty channels and he heard his ancient grandmothers voice
Tell him until you begin to sculpt your own destiny, your tears will be wasted and do no good.

He balled up his fists and went out determined to make the next step only to be gunned down by a high school shooting. With his last breath he uttered the prayer of the five mothers which he had learned as a child in the mountains from the large lady who controlled the water reserves. 

May the pipes run clean  
Water goes on  
For centuries  
Until it stops 
For salty  
Tears     

Amen.

poems.title: Hagoromo / Bubbling
poems.author: Yusuf Misdaq
poems.content:
Self releasing distance
Uncrackled knuckle
Freed knot
Ferried tapestry\
Out of a dream, you came
Your eyes and hands
Offering
Invisible morsels
Each one dangled
Like dancing dew drops on string grass
Perfectly incidental
A Korean garden
Things as they are
And sensual as they are
You're not letting go
And I'm tied
In you
Still
Freeing, you're
Offering freedom
Without words you're
Calling me whispering and
From your strange oval where
Only I can hear you among the insects\
Others are blind
We have a channel
None can see or reach me
We have a direct line, extending
We dial in, touchable and unrestrained
Touching bases with sweat and melted brains
We have a chance and we have each other to blame
The blame game is a retreaded kiss and backwards flexing wrist
A seeking out of each others prurient amethyst
Crystalline aesthete, I kiss your submissive feet
You deserve gold, and I offer you my intergalactical suite\
Come into it
Belong here with me
Begone with me
We perfectly possible
Finalities
Dragon seeds
Man in me's
Handsomely I
Ran to thee with
Magic seed. \

poems.title: Beaware
poems.author: Yusuf Misdaq
poems.content:
Children of the magnified era:
Paraglide into the past
Where things were held up
In high-regard and
Changes were humbly
Observed on their way in.

Children of the fantasy land:
Check your pulse before diving.
The faraway frontier can be had
But the streams you are dreaming of
Won’t fall in the direction of your will. 

Turn away from this insistence
This undignified resistance.
Mark upon your hearts
The baggy parts
With a tailors pin
Cut away this
Vengeful cyst
That you harbour. 

There is a gentle harbour
High in the mountains
A high sea
A rare sight
Mountainous dignity
Throat singers there
Are chanting
For your
Calm

poems.title: Untitled Napkin
poems.author: Yusuf Misdaq
poems.content:
Within me is all of the sloppy guts and memory\
I reach out my hand to touch her and wonder if she feels it
I wonder if she’s had children and if, because she truly loved me,
I might also be considered the father. \
I shampoo and condition my latest edition\
I’m in good shape I say as I towel off and admire
My jet black hair and tiger striped arms
I’ve got plenty more chances
And there’s no one like me.\
My soft and open face
In a dark room awakened
For nobody, but with all inroads
And outroads free\
poems.location: \cf2 Empty for every majestic delivery The goods on EarthThe promises of HeavenMy flower heart purring openAll incoming hands.February 22nd, Plane from DC to Los Angeles\

poems.title: People of Spirit make things last/flourish
poems.author: Yusuf Misdaq
poems.content:
Mine is a fanciful style
I let the pen glide and make loops
Flourishing my inner eyes and
Letting the dots transform into lines
Which I do in life
When I transform a simple thanks
Into a conversation about instinct
And you at your very you-est \
\

poems.title: Recovering from flu
poems.author: Yusuf Misdaq
poems.content:
Mecca is a line that goes through me \
I’m always on the way \
Laser distances \
never ending light \
\
I don’t run out\
I run to. \
\
Sometimes I let drool fall down the side of my mouth. \
Sometimes I let my trousers fall down to the floor\
Sometimes I laugh in the middle of the race\
I fall out of rhythm
Like a jagged poster
Like someone we call crazy
In their pyjamas
in the road
\
I've too fallen out of love with this world\
I'm ready to fly into the mud\
I believe in the afterlife\
And it is starting to smell nice.\

poems.title: Yuko's Kitchen, 1, 2, 3
poems.author: Yusuf Misdaq
poems.content:
1.
Gender reveal party
{Bring gloves} 

2.
Mimes are French 

3.
Everyone's talking about Elon Musk
Instead of the reason why
They themselves are shit

poems.title: Meet for Coffee
poems.author: Yusuf Misdaq
poems.content:
We meet new people
Tell each other about our enemies
And how we slayed our dragons
Tell each other about the times we were psychic
Tell each other about how we were right
And how we are in the middle of two extremes
And how we rebirthed our upbringing
Unwittingly testifying how correct our parents are
And make mention of our exceptions to the common rules
So that we can locate each others ends
Angles, heights and depths\
Deciding if we will ride in their boat
Off a waterfall
Hitch our bodies together
Two being more resilient.
Two being able to take twice as much shit. \
If you truly love animals you would go to the places they call home and enter with the humility of an uninvited guest. You would not confine these wild creatures to the electrified boxes where you choose to live. Heal yourself cold turkey. You are strong enough. Let the animals be free. \
\
q u i c k l y \
\
Don't squander your lives\
Your belly is
the lifespan of
planet earth\
breathe over your
history
and the stories
of everyone
that led to
you\
You can reach them\
You are a door
Swung open\
\

poems.title: Napkin in random cafe #1
poems.author: Yusuf Misdaq
poems.content:
Keep your nose
Out of can't and
I'm sick
Not good at
And the like\
You're not welcome there
Those neighbourhoods are dark
And wouldn't know what to do with
You - a being of light
A belle\
A bright spirit\
You belong in
I will
You can
We should
Lets!\
The way works itself out
You're only a small part of the math\
Step aside smiling\

poems.title: Aurtistic
poems.author: Yusuf Misdaq
poems.content:
Johnny Charango
Felicitus Munde 
Carebellum Dravidian Chalice Mondial 
Prebantum chakillius ferdinnia prosciutto 

My mother loves to watch me grow
Lovers love to watch me go
I'm the go-ho 
I go very much 
As I come forth bravely and
Set the scene anew

poems.title: Bye (and i e I, will always)
poems.author: Yusuf Misdaq
poems.content:
A good riddance burger
They ate together and the
Memories of their love played
for them like the warmth
of a friendly waiter. \
They didn't need to say much
the magnitude of the quake was felt
already. \
(...warm feeling...)
\

poems.title: This one's motivational
poems.author: Yusuf Misdaq
poems.content:
shim-shim
the pile-in
six or seventeen million
souls collectively floundering\
Whatever passes for surrender
a white flag
a tear
a sad morning in bed\
Assume it's been shown
Assume your prayer has been heard
Your teardrop dissolved
Your clenched fist, crushed. \
The request in your heart is in the queue and
will be answered in the order it was received only
after being translated back for you by God
who speaks immaculate jibberish today and who
will grant you sparkling gifts if
you make it to tomorrow\

poems.title: It's all worship
poems.author: Yusuf Misdaq
poems.content:
The only reason I'm staying in this coffee shop
Is Marvin Gaye
I sing because of Marvin Gaye\
*\
I'm a sheep from the land of taxes\
*\
I shape and mould\
*
A chime out of me
A resonance that beams
from my body \
I'm a glinting-giver\
People come to my experiences
And are bedazzled\
Most would never guess
I am just an orthodox boy
In love with God
And worshipping in
Different shapes\
poems.location: Spring 2023, coffee shop that played Marvin Gaye, LA, California. \

poems.title: The Promise (Visit from Jim)
poems.author: Yusuf Misdaq
poems.content:
Dull poetry hums through to me
Like neighbours dry humping unenthusiastically
behind the walls\
Jim Morrison lies in wait
Behind a bush of spirit\
[L.A. Woman comes on the radio about 6 seconds after I wrote that last sentence.] \
He grins mischeviously
Wider now
than he ever could on Earthtime\
He points to the missing watch on his wrist
and urges me to create chaos in all the libraries and stages I come to. \
I promise, I say, touching my
Chest where an obvious heart once was. \
'Mix it! Make it all a mix,
So there's no baseline of normality.'\
'They're counting on you,' he says calmly\
I won't let you down\
Won't let up\
I promise I will \
Fuck it all up right. \
poems.location: Fixed thermostat in the arugulan ageI'll share my hotspot with your instant potAnd together we'll slow cook like the world roasted suckling pig with all of the doors to outside closed and just me on the speakers turned up loudso that there's no-one else to hear but me. August 4th, 2023. Plane to Denver, Colorado. \

poems.title: Bi-Parmesan Dialogue
poems.author: Yusuf Misdaq
poems.content:
Two slaves in a cage set against each other
audiences cheer
some throw beer
and some jump in to
join the fight\
The referees and governing bodies
are useless
they're paid for
snakes in the
aftergrowth
drowning everyone
in their muffling bush\
The men grow vicious and
face off
one says to his enemy,
"I'll rob your eyes
if you look at me
I'll steal you
and bury you."\
The richer one wins in muscle
memory
And the loser, defeated, retreads
backwards to the
shadows
perhaps to return one day
with a darker face and scars. \

poems.title: USA, 2023
poems.author: Yusuf Misdaq
poems.content:
A stellar rider
I've come this far
Across a pristine passage where
The grass was short and firm
And the mountains clean
Without dust
And the villages
All neat and without
Sin or incident\
As though Switzerland
Or some other edifice of sanitization. \
I come to this place expecting more
satiated faces and
sturdy land
scapes\
but much to my surprise
i see
a broken shack roof and
a stumbling disaster man
falling out of the diagonal door
holding his face like a failed gambler
afraid to admit daylight \
another one is an old woman
but the word really is hag
and she approaches the disaster man
with her broken, dusty broom
whipping him unmerciful as he
lies on the floor groaning on
automatic underdrive\
the worms are unhappy in the muddy wet floor
so they stay under the ground
and never come out \
the spiders weave raggedy, useless webs
uneven and mathematically sloppy.
\
everything is waiting to die\
with all the time in the world. \

poems.title: Transmission from the abyss of absence
poems.author: Yusuf Misdaq
poems.content:
Secret canons\
Slow bullets
\
Currents buzzing alive inside
Creating anew Yu \
Give it to the government \
A jolt, shock them in their dreams
A fire, burn them from their toes
A change, happening from the edges \
‘Dredges of society,’ I say,
Caveman Yu\
Adressing you in ruptured slang outdated:
Have I ever lied to you?
Do you trusting me?
Knowing I representing fairly
Not he or her but our One.
Do you believe me what I say?
Well then let us unfurl further now
Because the time it come
Is now.\
\
In the name of Allah, gracious and merciful
Remain at home after dark. \
In the name of Allah, gracious and merciful
Marry, and do not delay in marriage. \
In the name of Allah, gracious and merciful
Chant ! The name of your Lord. \
In the name of Allah, gracious and merciful
Speak with your movements\
In the name of Allah, gracious and merciful
Movements of love and striking thunder\
Bismillah a Rahman i Rahim
Offer up the kindest drugs \
B’ism ilLah
The golden fortunes\
Lillahi
Your ocean homes\
Your moving hands
Your kissing bread baking
Your bicep’d cycling
Shukru lillah
For chances creating
Your children dispersing afountainous
To spread across the land and speak
More words of love \
Give all back
Give all away
Here, stay
Your home is the way\
And your garden
The flowers sprout
Make them glorious
Shatter the outer universe
What is there out there that is more than what you have?\
You have it all
The small pleasures and
Deep delights. \
Your life is a magical journey of lillah-love
Droplets are sprinkling on the bodies of water
And your feathers are rustling with joy. \
In closing I will remind you that
Excercising your back means
To take on weight, not avoid
All difficulty. \
And excercising your back
Will create the muscles that are the beginning of wings\
They have told you all of your life that humans don’t fly
And you have believed it for your entire life \
It is time for you to stop believing lies and join
The caravan of love
Wherein the name of Allah chanted
Creates actual levitation and
Your life begins. \

poems.title: Outsiders
poems.author: Yusuf Misdaq
poems.content:
I walk into the forest
The mist of the trees
Fails to be damp and cold
Fails to be hazy and unclear

The mist of the trees
Begins to be oxygen
Begins to be moisture

And in a droplet of time
New life grows upon my body

The outcast of the forest
Now has truffles
Now has flowers
Poring out

Some of the others in the town look in at me, now.
Before, they used to pour the bad smells onto me
Now it changes and little by little, children come in
And ask to smell this floris-anubis I have

They tell me I am bringing back the
Dead ones and the golden ways.

And soon, others will come in, too
Eager to proclaim me the
New colour.

poems.title: Time Capsule
poems.author: Yusuf Misdaq
poems.content:
Chim-chime \
Win-whine \
Sun-sine \
Brain-brine
\
I’ve slipped on enough stones
My life is slipping on wet stones \
I slip I almost fall and then get my footing on another slippery pebble which then turns traitor and slips me again and sometimes I will fall the way down and sometimes there’s a low hanging branch from nowhere that I can hold onto and it’s a good day
that when people say blessed
i don’t cynically second guess
I just say yes
repeating it,
blessed.\
We can’t agree on much anymore. \
I’ve become a secret hater
I withhold strategically the me that is too specifically me to be free
I let the invisible dogs hold back from attacking me \
My eye is on two doors
One leads to a life where I am permitted to remain in place, sheltering
The other is a green field where nobody knows my name and I can be forgotten by all under a dome of my own.
\
Everyone around me is working on a start up. They are all successful and they will all earn more money than I ever will.
I on the other hand am continuing my journey into the path of nothingness, now moving into year 15, or 17, or 32, or 41 or minus 6 months, or minus pre-eternity, depending on what point I begin counting.
When I am in fluid motion and creating, I know I am good.
When I am a man in the dungeon of dragons, I get competitive.
I feel it all and write it all so that this torpedo can slowly show the shit of it all as we boldly go.
I’m not afraid of growing old.
I’m in the process of a long conversation with God where i slowly turn to gold.
It’s not nice, I admit, picturing a cold home of stone with
no-one beside me to rub my shoulders when I moan.
But what do I own?
Even that which I would mine and refine I cannot call mine.
Every thing is driving its force away.
Down into an earthen compress.\
I see no reason to ask for what’s next.
I will be content with what I have and whatever I get. \
Thank you.
\

poems.title: Para el Flunkita
poems.author: Yusuf Misdaq
poems.content:
Oh dear thirsty self-assassin
How unwittingly you hunt yourself down
How subconsciously you charm out a snake,
of thin existence,
to bite yourself.
Slow yourself and stop all
Blood circulation\
If I could breathe a cure of this faith to your heart I would
But God said there must be no compulsion in it.\

poems.title: Wetness
poems.author: Yusuf Misdaq
poems.content:
Why is it that the smell of people when they have just come out of a swimming pool is so nice?
It is pure.
A woman's smell, just out of the swimming pool or ocean, may not be the cleanest smell in the world, or even the most natural, but it is nice.
Terribly nice.\
When wet and dripping, the humanoid seems most awake
and most close to whoever they speak to. \

poems.title: Sunset
poems.author: Yusuf Misdaq
poems.content:
The birds leave
Binding another sunset
Bonded in bleeding belief and
Besmoothing saline balm of
Explosion\

poems.title: Moments like teeth
poems.author: Yusuf Misdaq
poems.content:
Moments like teeth
Count them in their multitude
Feel the contours of each of them
The hidden parts
The main messages
The confusing contours
The crazy memories
The can it be?
The cold craters
The calm waters
The calculations
The caravans
Convoys
Conferences of
Creativity
Calling you
Calling you open
Carousel-ing a circle of
Serrated certitude which
Zig-zag sips through your
Years of lips
Years of tongue
Years of young
Split-seconds of
Youth, which are
Split-seconds of
Infinitude.\

poems.title: Rocket
poems.author: Yusuf Misdaq
poems.content:
Oh, intoxication!
Oh, sweat!
To be locked away in a dark space with you
Close upon my cheek
Hot and near\
To be taken
To be kept
To be cradled
To be smoothed\
To be rushed
To be shocked
To be touched
To be rocked\
And rocked in together
We rhythmical beasts
Your breath is losing
In the final beats\
Thunder
Inside
Rocket
Target
Final
Drops
of
Fuel
Infinity\
Free-er
Free-ing
Come with me. \
. Run-down rising .
Berry-believers
Chirps of a happy Paradise\
And we too
Purified through our fools fear
Running through the sheets of it
Relentlessly washing us in a bath of
Bulletlets bombing down as
God's hilarity-clarity
(And we are laughing too). \
No speed possible to avoid being
Soaked (seeped)
Slowly covered and our clothes
.Pointless.\
All iPods and Blackberries only inches away
Only a pocket away
From total destruction\
All our lives work
Only a flood away from
Zero-data
Forgotten forever. \
You can call it global warming
Or you can call it ingratitude to our
Latitude-mother
Who we've pissed and
Wasted away for too long. \
It doesn't matter.
Flood, typhoon or Earthquake.
God, mans's greed, or randominium
Millenium! \
Because if it doesn't get your iPod
It might get your home computer
(and your home).
If it doesn't get that
It'll get google's servers in rickety California. \
And when it's all gone
And it's pouring down
With no phone, fuel or
fantasy to escape to\
We're going to have to do something about dinner.\
poems.location: 22nd march, 2010. Orange Line Metro Station, West Falls Church, Virginia. \

poems.title: McDonalds after Midnight
poems.author: Yusuf Misdaq
poems.content:
Credit Columbia
Sanctified History
Sell me a Search
Sell me a Mystery

poems.title: Always
poems.author: Yusuf Misdaq
poems.content:
I sat down on the train
And took out my pen
And opened my book
And clicked the pen into life
And hovered it over an empty page
And kept it there for some minutes. \
What a nerve I have
Expecting inspiration to come.\
I look up at the blue sky passing
And the green trees tickling
But anything that does come to me
Is not fresh stars
Bur rather, tinned fruit. \
Then, a Chinese man sits down
Right in front of me
And sneezes!\
And now he keeps on grunting
And snorting,\
And I think:
Oh well... It's better than nothing!
\
poems.location: Tuesday 26th April, 2010. Metro Train, Washington D.C.\

poems.title: Human Feelings
poems.author: Yusuf Misdaq
poems.content:
Blankets of biographies
Books a million
Enough to sink a world
The throbbing weight of
Human feelings
Enough to bury us all\
poems.location: Early May, 2012. Triunfo de la cruz, Honduras.\

poems.title: Fana / Good Death
poems.author: Yusuf Misdaq
poems.content:
All roads melt into a swoosh
A curved line in the sunset sky
Drawn by the unnameable one
And tinged with something like
Orange & Light
(Light as a colour)

All paths apex at annhilation
Conjoining
Rejoicing in
Love pools. 

Wherever you go
Good death is hunting you.
poems.location: Early May, 2012. Triunfo de la cruz, Honduras.

poems.title: Great Man Artist
poems.author: Yusuf Misdaq
poems.content:
Pardon the moon\
Men make messages for a living
Wise men
Meaning not madness
Meaning magic out of moments
Not shallow magic\
Real men meander
Until they meet meaning
Then they get busy working
Cutting the bullshit
Fat trimming
Time surving on waves of days that
Arc and halo forever\
Real men touch the trickles
As they glide the tide
They like to touch the rush
Feel the candle of productivity
Flickering
Hands in time. \
Artists of invention
Dancing with tension.\
poems.location: Hard Ducks, still things, half-sunken statuesRipped out of the silent, large lakeSlanted and high-juttingDefeated and victoriousThe building is half demolishedLoose bricks in a fallen blueBroken. Strewn unceremoniouslyBreathing. Free.Every single window is smashed or cracked in some place.Someone would not rest. .Total ruin.Determined destructionHad to bloody happenFor the beauty of breath to breathe, and be felt againAnd whisper to the ears thatWhisper, “I hear.”I hear and obey. The only way is through fear and away Clouds pierced broken and the rocket is safe Ready for the riskiest thrust into fate.July 15th, 2012. NJ Transit Train en route to Metuchen, New Jersey.
poems.note: Source: Unoriginal Prayers for Desperate Men (Nefisa UK, 2015). Out of print\

poems.title: Santa Fe Obama Years
poems.author: Yusuf Misdaq
poems.content:
New Mexico is perfect nowhere
If that's too scary, you can go to Santa Fe
Which is a place, a somewhere.

It comes with a silly legend or two
And an agreed upon atmosphere
It's funded and advertised and
It's very nice to be there.

But you don't find much of oneself
When surrounded by like-minded people.
You won't get to outer space and beyond that way. 

Santa Fe is a station at the safe edge of outer space.
All of the astronauts that chickened out are there
Their space suits are hung up on a hook by the door gathering
Dust and they are now busy making a community
Filling it with words like young and
Vibrant and
Up and coming
the Arts
And so on. 

Georgia O'Keefe didn't die in Santa Fe
Not really.
She died in stillness
in
Mountain
and agreement with stillness
on the other side of space.

poems.title: Spring Certainties
poems.author: Yusuf Misdaq
poems.content:
Palm things. Deposited neatly into me.
I can hold them, or swallow them
I can feel like a world.
Existent. Solid. Of consequence. \
Sky things. Mountainousness.
Unbounded limitless
Oceans of power
Life is larger than space
Millions of unknown galaxies are going
Swimming suns. \
You'll find me stronger this year
Willing to go through more
More flexible spine
Bigger heart. Capacity.\
I've been working on my garden and
The fruits that came will get me through anything.
More than that, I will dress warmly
I will act accordingly
Live within my limits and be a
Straightforward person. \
WIth a wool bubble hat
And warm socks
I will walk through the snow with safety
I will love my nose to be cold
I will have a home to come gushing to
A love
to hold.
A God to be bold with.
A Large God
Giving
Expansion\

poems.title: Gloving Feeling
poems.author: Yusuf Misdaq
poems.content:
Cream. Light cream.
Rich beloved.
Blushed & covered.
Shy & high.
Long & lively. \
You dance around my heart like Michael Jackson in his early twenties. Glitter disco balls and amber lights and pure smiles of unrestrained, healthful light. \
Brownish skin is moist.
Cheeks are fixed in
Rounded joy. \
Moonlight loves you.
Under covers.
Nur finds you in pitch black. \
Cheeks. Teeth.
Eyes!\
The life of God in you illuminates. \
Good things glow.\

poems.title: Crystal Gunshots
poems.author: Yusuf Misdaq
poems.content:
Hawk my heart.
Gulp down destiny
My body will age through test
Hair will grey because I take
Secondary causes as real
Forgetting the forgiving landlord
Ensconcing myself in a sordid game of
tit for tat with tennants of temporality.
Giving those rings under my eyes
More reason to believe they have
a right to real existence. \
What truly exists?\
God. \
The rest of us are just fridge magnets. \

poems.title: Ignite!
poems.author: Yusuf Misdaq
poems.content:
I love Jesus and I was made of his light.
Who has the proof to disagree?
My body is forced open like a pistachio shell
Higher spirits are eager to crack me
And so I end up working in a factory
Where people spit on me
And everyone I've loved and helped
Spits on me
And there's no place in the sun for me
left
And the dark salted spirit within
comes out of the shade\
Disrobes
Emerges.
Henceforth:
Pearl. \
Now how can a thing stop me?
Freshly become me
Shedded of shreds and shards
Whole again
World again. \
Before I came here
I was everywhere.
I feel it.
It's why I make friends with everyone.
It's why nobody on Earth truly hates me
Not even her. \
If you've ever fucking loved
You will know. \
Professors, let your small naked willies
Rustle in the surreal wind of a Dali-scape.
You have nothing but those distant notions
Misty feelings of where we came from
And all that we gargantuan are. \
Gargantuan are, arcing across
Your mother to the blind beginning
Arcing rain-bows
To the start of our lineage
And the light that gave birth to it. \
Can't touch it.
Won't know it.
What I grasp at,
What we feel for.
\
Keys are in our hands
We lifetime reach
In slowest motion toward
The ignition
\

poems.title: JFK Airport, Gate 25
poems.author: Yusuf Misdaq
poems.content:
Menstrual cycles. Lunars.
Cats get hot in seasons somewhat predictable.
Divorced lovers rotate
Still dancing to
Weekly visitation rights\
Hot single girlfriends
Follow the gay man with energy
One, two, three
Regularly
Aquatically,
Zumba-ly\
Freshly twisted lovers kiss
Mini-swan kisses
Rhythmic and quick, to
The invisible beat of satisfaction.\
Happy child asks father, “why?”
9 Times in a row
Attempting to lead daddy
To the very Essence of all causes.\
Step by logical step
We walk wildly toward the Unified
Wilderness of God.\
poems.note: Source: Unoriginal Prayers for Desperate Men (Nefisa UK, 2015). Out of print\

poems.title: Why Don't You Do What You Dream?
poems.author: Yusuf Misdaq
poems.content:
The roads don't remain open after a certain time.
After too much doubt and delay
A roadblock will be set-up.
It will be guarded by inhumans.
And suddenly you will find yourself caught
As in a dream
Where you can't run forwards
No matter how much you want to\
And you'll think
'Why didn't I take this road before?
When it was here
When I had time
Before this corrupt government came to power
Before all these other complicated factors came into being?
They gained power whilst I lazed
And made excuses.'\
Back then, before,
Action was friendly next-door neighbours with
Intention.
You were only an easy window away
From accomplishment.\
Now, everything becomes dark and furrowed
Buried in some uncompromising
Gravel, which scrapes your knuckles with blood
Each time you meekly try to negotiate it.\
(And each time, you’re more bloodscared to try again.)\
In this time, which is to come
Your enthusiasm, energy and will-power will be a
Pathetic shadow
Of what they are right now\
Your right-now-body is filled with the kinetic
Charge of flush-life
Domains of wind are whistling inside you
Waiting for a castle to run through\
Waiting for you to make things
And take rational risks that seem insane
\
poems.note: Source: Unoriginal Prayers for Desperate Men (Nefisa UK, 2015). Out of print\

poems.title: Rejected (Stamped & Awaiting Deportation)
poems.author: Yusuf Misdaq
poems.content:
Perfume . Please it be everywhere.
Plush polish me I’m so nowhere
Going headfirst into challenges
Losing my ruby spark
Drained of my juices\
Stark nobodies unsouling my heart
Dethroning and dishonouring my art.\
\
poems.note: Source: Unoriginal Prayers for Desperate Men (Nefisa UK, 2015). Out of print\

poems.title: Where All Rivers Meet
poems.author: Yusuf Misdaq
poems.content:
If there was a place where all rivers meet,
that’s where I knew you.\
If there was a place where everything came from,
we were there.
\
We cried out a parable and let the world make a fool of us\
We slept through a disaster and
had a wonderful time
in a dream\
What a joyous feast for the lonely heart
the foul heart
the wretched heart
\
We received all the goodness we were due
Got every delicious drop that we deserved\
And not one drab drip more.\
\
poems.note: Source: Unoriginal Prayers for Desperate Men (Nefisa UK, 2015). Out of print\

poems.title: Attunement
poems.author: Yusuf Misdaq
poems.content:
Huu is the hereafter
  Bird is the drink
   Clouds are the smoke
    and
     Hearts are the pink

Where is my lover? They say
Where? I’m looking.
Everyone wanders the streets of theories
Earnestly digesting never-ending books from
The library of tick-time.

Where is my lover? They ask, repeatedly
                                                           aloud
                                                  Forming the question with their
                                     two lips, which flap around like
                         Ostentation
            Bouncing up and down like a
salesman
            in a suburb
                         Missing the point

           .(And then talking about missing the point).

The answer is raining down upon them
And inner their humid-hearts
If only they had ears more
Attuned to the subtle drama
Of silent droplets.
poems.note: Source: Unoriginal Prayers for Desperate Men (Nefisa UK, 2015). Out of print

poems.title: Proposition
poems.author: Yusuf Misdaq
poems.content:
My moon tonight is a lilting tusk
    A midnight musk

Scatterings of dancing girls surround it like
Jewelry of history
Motion caught in time and
Kept there for eternity
For Alexander and I to marvel at

Separated by centuries
As the dead stars and us are
Separated by life cycles of uncountable eons
Sleeping through existence
Or slowly awake for all time

Uniting us and watching with a softened, veiled glance as we
Murder one another with serious faces on and
Sweat-sin to get disgusted and thin

We waste away woefully woe-begotten
Asking where and why and where again in maggot-iterations
Trawling across a 10-mile trash heap for 80 years, fully zoomed in.
Or worse: feeling comfortable, loving it all
Thinking that we understand
And feeling understood!
What a woe-is-me neighborhood!

My moon is gorgeous as your dear heart
And my dear hearts attachment to yours is
A fragment of time
A shard or a splinter in this robed
Jewel encrusted chandelier called here

Let’s encircle one another for a glad, gifted lunar year

See what becomes misty and what becomes clear.
poems.note: Source: Unoriginal Prayers for Desperate Men (Nefisa UK, 2015). Out of print.

poems.title: Begins Backwards
poems.author: Yusuf Misdaq
poems.content:
The living words of luxury
upon life
are poems\
When the insides of a man
become tearfully beautiful
swirls of sunset clouds
That is when a poem is.\
It lasts as long as a sunset
(Over all too soon and
Forever, in untime)\
It rewinds a man like backwards footprints on nimble sand
Until man becomes the beautiful baby sitting in front of him on the beach\
\
And the birds of God
fire off into a hexagonal victory\
And the word of love
is flashed within
in a moment we won’t remember\
poems.note: Source: Unoriginal Prayers for Desperate Men (Nefisa UK, 2015). Out of print\

poems.title: Hard Winter
poems.author: Yusuf Misdaq
poems.content:
In the name of Goodness
Desolation exists,
as an avenue of access
Smooth and supple

Despair     tickles
Boredom      suggests
Unhappiness      desires

On the other side of the misty pond is sheer
Joy. Fantasy and bells that swing like
Drunk doors flapping open and closed,
                                                             aaaand open !
Held on a string
Pulsing like a palace-ring-ring
Delighting and trilling on bending beats that
Make time and space mere footnotes of the play sheet

Turn in, from desolation, despair, boredom and overcastness.
Turn in one more turn to this place. It is closer than you think, and always
here. Do you not feel it at least once each day? One joy. One moment,
where you can be in one spot and feel one yes?

Search for it within your diamond-day.
Expand it beyond a moment.
Diversify it and keep on investing in it.

       . Your portfolio expands .
Heart is rising to the clouds, though you still look normal and regular.

The whispers of heaven are scars of love and memory
You are covered in them.

Let us enter the House of the Lord.

    Where is He?
       
          He is
poems.note: Source: Unoriginal Prayers for Desperate Men (Nefisa UK, 2015). Out of print\

poems.title: See (Of Love)
poems.author: Yusuf Misdaq
poems.content:
Pelleniums,
Paxital
Sever the severity
Fleximability\
To make love is to move
Flexibly.\
What core of purity and trust do you move with?\
If you have no core of trust
You don’t move in the right ways
And sex becomes a meaningless waste of time
Hardly even an exercise in exercise
Let alone love.\
What is love? While we’re here...
What is love?
I promise not to start the next sentence with “Love is.”\
I am wandering alone
In a blue dawn before time
My heart pulses peacelets
Which let the love in me ~ stretch ~ and say
Where?
An open heart at dawn says
Where? But not with angst
With hope.\
An open smile at dawn
By the sea
Which is looking back at us
And sees in us much of what we see in it:
Undulating beings who flicker in and out of existence
At one moment present
Then absent.\
Whitecapspray-lives of foam washing up on the
Temporal shore
Wash your jewelry in the foam
While it lasts
You wave
Says the sea
You epheme-wave, washing nothing and
Part of the whole land though you don’t perceive it
Connected to the soil and clay
Of it
Fluttering up towards me on a clear day
You human scum so beautifully pristine
You washing, weary-eyed magicians of love conjuring
Where to go
Where for you to go?
You come to me and say you’ll join with me\
You try\
I take some of you, sometimes.\
You look to me and say you’ve come from me
Some of you are biologists and mean it literally
Some of you are Sufi and mean it symbolically\
You are not fish now
And perhaps I come of you.
There’s no I for the sea
We’re made and we’re here\
W’don’t waste our good time on definition
Or poetry
We just be
As commanded.\
Still I love you
Still I see
You make funny faces at me
Gorgeous darlings of ubiquity\
If I could only take you all under me
Show you the inner beauty
That you could meaningfully come to me
Without huge metal tubes on your back and masks of plastic
And fake fish feet.
If you could come to me as you are
I’d show you what beauty lies deepest within me.
Not the coral reefs which you marvel at like flowers
And can be the topic of a ‘conversation’ using ‘words’
But the almost formless essence of my deepest part
My blackness of depth
Where a constant bass emanates
Rumbles and shimmers in pitch-nothingness.\
Where you cannot be.
But then, I remind myself
Why worry about they cannot see\
The very same certified darklight
That you are blind to
Resides within thee\
And therein
Forevermore
Shall it be.\
\
Your trust is a fishing hook you
Cast out into the water
You’ll either be rewarded handsomely with a
Jewelled being from the deep\
Or you won’t.\
No disaster, including death,
is a loss
or an argument against trust.\
Cast your bird out of the cage of fear.\
What you fly into
of nets,
no’s
nevers and
negatives
are only of life.\
And what is there in this
Life that you cannot fly free from?\
You are a flucking bird!\
You lucky mother-flocker!\
Always home.\
\
poems.note: Source: Unoriginal Prayers for Desperate Men (Nefisa UK, 2015). Out of print\

poems.title: Baggage
poems.author: Yusuf Misdaq
poems.content:
“Baggage” is the ugliest word in the English language.
If not, it’s up there.
poems.note: Source: Unoriginal Prayers for Desperate Men (Nefisa UK, 2015). Out of print

poems.title: Good
poems.author: Yusuf Misdaq
poems.content:
Keep on watering
Despite what you might think you don't see
Keep on watering...\
\
poems.note: Source: Unoriginal Prayers for Desperate Men (Nefisa UK, 2015). Out of print\

poems.title: Last breakup e-mail
poems.author: Yusuf Misdaq
poems.content:
The children emerge from the forest, holding medals that shine and a crowd quickly gathers around them.

"Where have you been?" Ask the voices

The children, all smiling, put their medals away and tell a fantastic tale, of a dream that was a nightmare that was a dream, filled (and fueled) from start to finish with love. They speak of a wise and kind man and a beautiful young woman who looked after them, and other wild beasts and insects who formed stories and moments that would remain indelibly stamped upon their young free hearts forever; it had been an education in wonder and giving, they said. And this education would forever inform all of the serious and wondrous events that they would go on to partake in throughout their lives.

poems.title: Integrity
poems.author: Yusuf Misdaq
poems.content:
Grated carrots go bad quicker than carrots with their integrity still intact

Houseplants aren’t as strong as the ones rooted in the planet

If you make it rain, you lose all of your money

It’s better to stay whole.
Retire into a hole.
Figure yourself
Into silence
Go untrue
to the world
and let all tablets
powders and lotions
devolve back to the plant
the original green of health
the salver of all pains, whose
scent
         cuts
                 grief

a thousand wishes and blowers
the dandelion pods of fur
the set free graceful birds
and the prettiest milken words

fall back into me
the pool in the cave
that leads back toward my center

take your root within me
and stay there blooming in my
shuffle core

im not clever and
i have no more energy

i’m so sorry
it can only be
you

poems.title: At "Domingo" Station
poems.author: Yusuf Misdaq
poems.content:
Thin cows graze gently on sparse shrubs
Satisfied under the overcast sky 
That holds the vast desert in place. 

I don't eat beef. 
I just hug their kind bodies and cry. 
We just look out together at the river that's dry. 

The land is losing
Gold destiny bruising
A controlling cruise on
Autopilot is what we choose. 

We put all our brains and lives into computers and now we're empty. 
Dry rivers. 

Scared, dead old men
Are rummaging around the slag heap with 
Dry mouths and rock hard, chemical willies that
Won't waver in the wind nor
Help us win.

"Give me more," he says, pointing to his mouth
Last words. 

The vision puts fear into me
I hold the cow tighter
And we look out, this time at the mountain
And the misty mountains behind it

      They are reachable
      Like the idea of flying 
      
      (If we can think of it. . . )
poems.location: September 12th, 2012. Rail Runner Train towards Santa Fe, New Mexico.

poems.title: Hollywood Blvd., before sunset
poems.author: Yusuf Misdaq
poems.content:
Chime parlance
Caregivers receive the 
Divine sustenance while
Others bemoan their luck
Imbalance; a famous Hollywood
Star is bowed in humble prayer
Completed in a gratitude far broader 
Than the poor one with the headitude of a pitiful victim

poems.title: After dhikr sitting alone in theater
poems.author: Yusuf Misdaq
poems.content:
So much joy 
Chimera

I was crying at the misty dawn
Green
             arc of brick over green
Something tufted hedges and 
Mist hanging like logic
Jesus fairmount chiming in on
Horseback where the shadows have gone
Trying and tumbleweed
Starguts and cowbells

poems.title: After dhikr sitting alone in the library
poems.author: Yusuf Misdaq
poems.content:
Save me, when I am quiet on weekends  
I hear it inside.  
it’s a small everything 

It’s my cells crying all at once 
Save me, they say 
And they are all crying 
In Dari it’s called gereeyan 
And it sounds like it.  

This feeling has gone from my heart to my deeper heart.
It lies there in secrecy.  
The main heart has become an accomplice to lies 
It protects the feeling that says save me 
It hides it, covers it from me  
Trying not to let me see  
So I stay running on  
This wheel and  
Never make  
The call to  
Confront 
My past 
And say 
I’m sorry  
I will always    
Love you.

poems.title: Laughter is the God-Gene
poems.author: Yusuf Misdaq
poems.content:
a pearl in a species
  tracks from a heart
   to a no-distance heart

Connect smoothly.

Unfunnel to your Creator the megaphone
Declaration, 
say, "I came in flame
        Balls of fire
        And I burnt,

        and you rotated me

And now here I am again
Where I started and 

I Love you

Lav you

Laff you

Laugh.

poems.title: (Prayer for this place)
poems.author: Yusuf Misdaq
poems.content:
Many people live here
Advertisements for Fatigue, Heart Palpitations
Stress, all !n bullet points¡!¡!¡!¡!¡!¡!
                                                 .May they rest.

May pool tables have no hustlers crowded around
May they not have people hitting balls with big sticks and bragging about
each others dicks like meat-men.
May pool tables be filled with light water that people gather around to jump into
And may these portals not be located in dark halls under smokey lamps but
On the pulsing street corners of all neighborhoods in need.

May the portals take men where man can go.
poems.note: Source: Unoriginal Prayers for Desperate Men (Nefisa UK, 2015). Out of print
